Reviews.Title: “Walk everywhere in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: SueSheeNJ
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean with Huge rooms and attached to monstrous Fitness center - Be Aware - the pool is NOT kid friendly - once it has 20 kids in it, they close the pool and your kids will be told to wait in the lobby. Parking on street lots $10/day - dont get ripped off parking at hotel. Charles St garage is 3 blocks away - and its $3/day.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: boyceake
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here from Good Friday thru Wednesday. The front desk staff was very helpful. Kudos to Jasmine and Sharon on check in and Jasmine and Lamarr upon checking out. They were extremely nice which is a plus. Breakfast everyday is good especially with kids. You can get made to order omelets, french toast and giant waffles. All were good. The staff in the dining area were also very efficient and helpful because sometimes you may have to wait a few minutes for a table, but they handle the crowds well. The gym is extremely nice and it was a nice perk that Arod was there for a workout and my kids got autographs! The location is awesome so close to Aquarium and shops and the Water Taxi. Having Whole Foods and CVS a block away was a nice thing. If we ever get back we will use this hotel again. The room was comfortable and had 2 TV's and kept very clean so thanks to the housekeeping staff also.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back and visit!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly P
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this Hotel and loved it!!! Our room was beautiful and clean. Loved the full breakfast that was included. Short walking distance to the Aquarium, Trade Center, and many more places. Everyone in Baltimore was so friendly and very customer service oriented! Had lunch at a great Irish Pub directly across the street from this hotel--food was great. Also had a delicious dinner at the cheesecake factory. I also liked the convenience of parking in the hotel garage; parking rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: There for several days on business. The staff was excellant, the rooms were comfortable. They serve breakfast each morning and dinner Mon-Thursday. It is all free and nice when you are looking to save money. Although you will want to get out for dinner at one of the many good places nearby. It is near the bay and easy walk. You dont want to go to far off the beaten path though. The inner city of Baltimore is really, really, bad. I could not get over the terrible living conditions with abandoned buildings and people lotering. Again, though you will be fine in the area of the hotel. If you get a chance, DC is only 40 minutes away. You can drive up there for early dinner and walk the main parts and be back in no time. Beds were comfortable and all rooms are suites with kicthens, sofa, desk etc. (free wi-fi). There is a awesome gym that guests can use in the building. Parking is valet $32/night or self park $22/night. the self park though is per in/out. I highly recommend spending the extra $10 per night. It is a lot safer and much more convieint.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: joan3boys
Reviews.Content: We were able to pick out our room after we made our reservation so we picked what looked like a huge corner suite. We were right, the room was wonderful. This hotel is newer and in an excellent location in walking distance to all. The managers dinner was great for grabbing beer and wine, many were using it for dinner. This hotel has their breakfast/managers reception area connected to the restaurant so food was somewhat better than other Homewoods. We would love to come visit this property again the only issue was no perk was waiting for us for being diamond members.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Seapinesmiserable
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is first class. It is run well and the concierge is very friendly and hard working. The room is great, the location of the hotel is great and the price is great. The Inner Harbor is a five minute walk. I recommend this Hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Going back again”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: Going back again in April 2012. The great rooms, full breakfast every day and dinner 4 nights a week, make this hotel for my long stay more cost effective than others. Plus a staff (front desk, valet, and servers) that actually remember you. It does become a home away from home. Walking distance from shops, many restaurants, "Whole Foods" and the Inner Harbor attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good locale, friendly staff, clean and stylish”
Reviews.Author: cbotterb
Reviews.Content: I have nothing at all to complain about this hotel. Very clean, neat swivel-mounted TV that turns around to face different areas of the suite. The kitchen was more than adequate for a long term stay, and the adjacent Whole Foods, Starbucks, and James Joyce Irish pub make for nice options if you prefer something other than the hotel's offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Inner Harbor location!l”
Reviews.Author: jabo123
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location! Little Italy, all Inner harbor attractions, restaurants and more are within a walk or short cab ride. There is a health club attached to the hotel. Services at this club include a pool and work out machines. These are free for hotel guests. The free Charm City Circulator bus is nearby which takes you to many different areas. CVS is nearby open 24 hours. The free breakfast was normal fare (eggs, bacon, sausage, coffee, etc.). We felt our room was a little cramped for 4 adults. We had one large open room with a king bed , pull out sofa and kitchen area. There was only 1 TV and no wall separating the sofa from the bed. We would go back to this hotel but get a larger room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: If you are not familiar with Homewood Suites, this is a Hilton property that is similar to the Residence Inn by Marriott - it has all large suites (some studios and 1BR and 2BR) with a full kitchen. In my opinion, the studios are better laid out for business travelers. The amenities include free microwave popcorn in room, free dinner/reception Sun-Th with wine/beer, free full breakfast. P.S, I am a Hilton Diamond member so I stay at Homewood Suites a lot and I am very picky. This Homewood Suites is very new, and somewhat atypical. It is a 12 story building - not spread out like most (however, it is inner city unlike most). It shares the building with a Hilton Garden Inn (same lobby, parking garage). The front desk is split -left side Homewood Suites (go up left elevator to rooms), and Hilton Garden Inn on right side. The second floor has the "lounge" for breakfast/dinner. The room is laid out a bit different than most Homewood Suites, with a non-movable combo desk/dresser splitting the room in half with the flat screen TV attached to the top next to the desk - you sit at the desk 2 ft from TV screen. PROS: * Very modern and clean. * Quiet, thermostat controlled temperature (central heat/cold - not window unit). * Extremely accommodating and pleasant staff - they know customer service here. * Close to everything - Roy's across street, Talera next door, Movie Theater, Starbucks and HaaganDas Ice Cream next door on other side, Whole Foods behind. Littly Italy and Fells Point within walking distance. Very safe neighborhood (Inner Harbor East). * Very quiet (however higher floors are better) and ample light from large windows * Large bathroom * Easy on and off from I-83. * Good price/excellent value CONS (Mostly minor): * Expensive parking ($32/night). * Not close to convention center which is on the west side of the harbor. * Spotty housekeeping service - Not all towels replaced daily (they took but did not leave any behind 2 of 4 days I was here), popcorn/coffee never replaced - but was correctly instantly by front desk who provided extra box of cookies for trouble. Comforter cover never replaced - saw the same stains every day. This is the main reason I did not give it 5 stars. * Drawers for clothes are a bit small. * Very slow internet at times. One point to be aware of: They say they have self-parking (entrance off Exeter St), but it is run by a private garage and you will have to pay every time you go in and out - cannot bill on hotel. However, you can enter hotel directly from garage. Valet parking is very good (valet remembered my name every day) and quick (can text for car in AM). They were able to switch from self to valet at check-in. Also if driving in Baltimore area, be aware of many photo-enforced speed traps. Overall this was a great place to stay and I will pick it as my first choice when in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: ecrmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick family trip to Baltimore in November. Hotel is connected to the Embassy Suites and there is one, understaffed front desk for both Hilton branded hotels. We are Hilton Honors Diamond card holders...however, there was no separate line for check in for either hotel. We mistakenly booked a smoking room and did not realize it. When we arrived and found out, we asked to be switched to a non smoking room since two of us have asthma and can't stay in a smoking room. After 15 minutes of staring into a computer with the check in line growing and growing behind us, they decided they did not have any comparable non smoking rooms that evening (a Friday night) but we were assured we would be able to switch for the second night of our stay. Since it was our mistake, we were disappointed, but agreed to wait until the second night to switch and we squeezed into a smaller room that was non smoking. They said they would call us as soon as the new room was available and would move our luggage for us. Went up to the complimentary evening reception and I got the last glass of wine from the pitcher, which they were not refilling even though there was a half hour left until the end of the stated time, and the food was mostly gone and not being refilled as well. Our room was nice and clean, but a bit cozy for my family. Next day we left our luggage packed and ready to be moved, and when we returned from sightseeing around 4pm it was all as we had left it. Made another visit to the overworked front desk, and spend another full 20 minutes waiting for them to find a room to move us to as promised...no one had done anything about it. And once again the check in line behind us grew as I heard grumbles and felt the angry eyes staring at the back of my head while I waited for the front desk staff to do their job. Finally they found us a room - again and they sent the porter up with me to help with the bags (very nice guy...the only person in the whole hotel who actually did his job with a smile). Valet parking was fine...we left our car there and walked to downtown and the aquarium. The other odd thing about the hotel was that it did not really have it's own pool, but rather was attached to a gym that we were allowed to use. While the gym and pool facilities were nice, the gym closed early on the weekends and my children were very disappointed they could not go in the pool in the evening. The location was so convenient and the hotel was fine. I think, however, that I would not stay here again unless Hilton steps in and brings the level of service up to par with what we expect from a Hilton property of this type.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - Another Hit By Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LIGINI
Reviews.Content: Weekend escape for two adults. Our suite had a full kitchen, living room, bath, one bedroom. LCD screen TV's in both bedroom and living room. Also think sofa in living room is a pullout sofa. (I'd recommend this type of rooms for families with small kids.) Place looked brand new, or close to it - immaculately clean. Usual comfortable bed by Hilton (though seemed a bit short for a King.) Very nice furnishings, tile work in room, and nice lobby area. Room was quiet, and windows partially open for fresh air. Building was shared with the Hilton Garden Inn, though the rooms for the Homewood Suite side looked much larger and appeared to be nicer. Health Club inside same building (free access for guests) is the size of a supermarket, with several pools. Can walk to "Inner Harbor" and "Fells Point." Free breakfast was your typical Hampton Inn buffet - nothing great, but not bad. Staff very helpful. Would stay again. (And because of the usual good rooms, I always try to stay at a Hilton owned property.)

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly with good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Uetzi-Team
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend with our two young children, and really liked the accomodation and the location of the hotel. The rooms looked fresh and had plenty of space for an extra crib even after converting the sleeper bed. The breakfast room can get busy on a Sunday morning with many families staying, but the staff tries hard to dish the tables and replenish the food. There were a few minor glitches (some dishes missing in the cabinet, baby crib not already installed as we had asked for) but the hotel more than made up for it by giving us a free in-room movie and some popcorn (horray!). Very friendly staff in general. We did not take advantage of the access to the nice fitness club including pool that the hotel is adjacent to, but it looked like an additional plus. The location of the hotel is great for visits to the Inner Harbor, and also only about a 15 min walk (20 with children) to the Fell's Point neighborhood, with many entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Area!”
Reviews.Author: mmosher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night before leaving on our cruise from Baltimore. We used valet parking for $34/night thinking that was all that was available but heard later there was self parking for $23. The valet worked well for us and all staff out front was friendly. We checked in early with no problems and were in our one bedroom, two double bed suite by 2:00. The room was clean, had kitchen and living area, TV in living and bedroom and free internet access. It was an easy walk to Pier 5, we visited the lighthouse, which is free and went to the Hard Rock for Lunch. Easy walk to Aquarium and historic ships also. Later we used to pool facilities which are part of a health club and are very nice with hot tub, lap pool, plain pool and lots of workout equipment – the only downside is that the pool was closing at 6pm on a Saturday which is early for a hotel pool. There was a wholefoods market very close by if you were staying for the week that would be great. The breakfast was included, it was ok. The view from our room wasn’t good – I don’t know if you could try to get something better or if they don’t exist here. I would stay here again. The drive to the cruise port wasn’t bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Andrews_Mommy
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. Rooms are really great -- all suites. Free breakfast is fine. Business center nice. Pool and fitness facilities excellent. Location is AWESOME! Right where you want to be in Baltimore. Walk to Inner Harbor. Starbucks right next door. Whole Foods out the back entrance. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and inexpensive in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Oshawott
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights to include the New Years. Hotel is shared with sister Hilton Garden Inn. Lobby is not very exciting, but the rooms are clean and in good condition. Rate was $139 which is good for a downtown hotel. Free breakfast which was adequate. There is a Starbucks next door, a drug store and large grocery store around the corner. Several nice restaurants on the same block, and easy walking distance to all the features of Inner Harbor and Fells point. A bit of a hike for a ball game. Little Italy is across the street. The staff was quite good. We had a broken door handle and while an inconvenience at 10pm, staff was prompt at fixing it and very apologetic . Except some street voice very quite, slept well. Fitness center is access to a very large, clean, upscale health club in the building. Big plus if you that is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: vinoveritas59
Reviews.Content: We visit Baltimore on an annual trip to dine and see the Ravens. This is our choice hotel for the past two stays and we've been pleased both times to see the continued consistency in the hotel. The hotel is clean, and very close to the Inner Harbor and varied neighborhoods in Baltimore. You can walk from this hotel anywhere you wish to see. We booked a king studio, layout is perfect for our needs, as we like to have coffee in the morning and cocktails before we go to dinner. For the price, you can't beat the value. The parking garage is connected, well lit, and reasonable $23 per day.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in the Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: mellcola
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Homewood Suites Baltimore November 10 & 11, 2011. Our room had 2 rooms: a bedroom and living room/kitchen. We had a view of the harbor and a lovely landscaped roundabout with a sculpture in the middle. There is a light dinner in the evening during the work week. Breakfast is served every day. Both are complimentary. If you have the time to work out, the fitness center is first class. There are many cardio machines, resistance weight machines and a fabulous pool. I wish I had brought appropriate clothes to take advantage of the health club. Our only negative is with the valet, who did not bring our car, even with 30 minutes notice.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Inner Harbor - great stay”
Reviews.Author: TAfanSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Homewood Suites. Beautiful hotel and a great stay. The room was very nice, with a kitchen. I had a great view of the harbor. The staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great People-horrible management”
Reviews.Author: MrDavidSmith
Reviews.Content: I almost hate writing this review because the staff was great (for the most part). However, when management makes such bad decisions then I have to tell others. CHECK-IN/FRONT DESK: The Homewood Suites and Garden Inn share a front desk. No biggie, I've seen this before, especially in urban core areas. HOWEVER, there were usually only two people working the front desk. TWO PEOPLE FOR TWO FULL SIZE HOTELS. Those ladies still managed to keep a smile on their face even when they had a long line of worn out and angry guests. RESERVATIONS: We had booked a room at the Homewood with two doubles and a fold out so our family of five could fit comfortably. However, management had overbooked the hotel so our room was not available when we checked in around 6pm. So they moved us to two side by side rooms (not adjoining) in the Garden Inn. Ok, not a big deal. It WOULD HAVE been a big deal if we had brought food to cook for dinner in the Homewood like we had originally planned. (but we didn't, so I won't complain) BUT then, they made us move the next night (we were only there two nights) to a Homewood Suites. Once again, this SHOULDN'T have been a big deal. I did book a room in the Homewood and not 2 in the Garden Inn. HOWEVER, because there were never more than two people at the front desk, this meant I had to wait 30 minutes to check out and get our luggage stored in the morning and then another 30 minutes to check in and get our luggage into our room new room that evening. ROOMS: Yes, there were issues with the rooms. Several guests, including ourselves, didn't have hot (it wasn't cold-but to call it warm was a stretch) water in the Garden Inn. Then, when we moved to the Homewood the ceiling fan was literally falling down. When I called to the front desk they did send someone up (30 minutes later) and the maintence guy started looking at it to see if he could put it back in and it fell on him! (Luckily he wasn't hurt-he was so disturbed by the whole event that he left all his gear in our room-including an uncovered knife and needle nose pliers-luckily he called us 30 minutes later to tell us before one of our kids found them! (Ok, these are minor things that I don't usually care about-but given everything else they just added to the frustration) PHONES: Our cells had poor service in the building so we decided to order out for pizza. I checked the phone info sheet-no mention of charges-and dialed several local numbers. The third call finally went through. Later that night I had to make another call to the same delivery place. The next morning I had charges for four phone calls! Even if the call didn't go through (when I say didn't go through I mean fast busy or the call cannot be completed as dialed) they still charged us. (the nice overworked front desk staff-who knew me by name now-quickly removed the charges) POOL: Once again, normally not a big deal-but with everything else it was just icing on the cake. First, the pool is part of MAC, an fitness center, no biggie, usually. But, the first night it was closed for a staff party and no one told the hotel. Then both mornings it was closed for swim lessons. So, we planned to take the kids to the pool-which had been raved about by a porter and the concierge as having a great kids area and even a slide(I thought this was odd since it was part of an urban fitness club but, hey, maybe they also cater to the families in nearby Little Italy?) So we make the trek down from our upper level room across both hotels to the MAC, I go to sign in and the nice lady at the desk says, "Oh, you can't come in here-you don't have shoes on." Yes, you need shoes for the pool. So, the three kids and I trek back up to the hotel and come back down-this time with shoes-and make our way to the wonderful kids pool. Only to discover that it's nothing but a standard size urban inside hotel pool. Still, it's November and we have a good time. That is, until my two oldest (7th and 4th grade) decide they want to swim some laps while I play with the youngest in the pool. There were several open lanes and I explain lap etiquette and they have themselves a good ol time seeing who could swim faster or longer-the whole time being very respectful and quiet. Until they get kicked out because kids aren't allowed to swim in the lap pool. VALET: I don't use valet so, once again, not something I would usually comment on but since it arose, here it goes. There were maybe three guys working valet (4 on the night I checked in) and they always were running. I figured they were hustleing to be good employees. No, they were hustleing because there weren't enough people working-this happened every day. In my long time at the front desk (I easily spent an hour and a half over two nights at the front desk) I heard countless people getting their valet charges credited because they were waiting 45mins+ for their car. The valet parking garage is attached to the hotel. Need I say more? In summary, these hotels are staffed with friendly (if slightly uninformed people) that are doing the best the can with poor management overseeing them. Would I go back? NEVER Do I hope all the nice employees find a better place to work? YES!

Reviews.Title: “What does HHonors early check-in mean?”
Reviews.Author: nationalparkPa
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 rooms for 2 nights for a family gathering 3 months in advance. I also signed up for the Hilton Honors card which offered early check-in as a "privilege." When I called on 3 separate occasions to ask about early check-in, I was told we would have to actually show up at the hotel no more than an hour before regular check-in and IF our rooms were ready we would be allowed to check-in early. When booking we also asked for adjoining rooms and were assured they were available. Upon check-in at 3pm, those rooms were not available because someone was checking-out late. We also checked-in at different times since we were coming from different locations. When my son arrived late, he was not allowed to check-in until I came to the lobby. Luckily, I was still in the building. The temperature in 2 of the rooms was a stifling 83 degrees when we arrived. Even with the windows open and the fan going, we were only able to get the temperature down to 73 degrees after 2 days. The hallways were very hot as well. The best thing I can say about the whole experience was that the rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But....”
Reviews.Author: Amishcowboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location is great, Staff Friendly, Nice Suite, However, they didn't have the Suite available I paid for, First time in over 10 years of Booking rooms with Hotels.com that I have had any issues. They said they were overbooked and they we were assured only of a room, I think our late check in had something to do with it, so I can't recommended this Hotel because you don't know what your going to recieve.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Ree65
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10/22 through 10/23 2011. The Homewood Suites and Hilton Garden inn are in one building and share a check in desk. We were in Baltimore for just a night in an extended stay suite, but the suite was just what we needed. The 1 bedroom suite had a full kitchen and a seperate sitting area. The size was good with a pull out couch in the sitting area. Excellent for 2 adults and a 7 year old. The couch could use some updating and the dresser in the bedroom was a bit scratched up. Free hot breakfast including breakfast burritos and standard continental fare. We didn't leave hungry in the morning. The Maryland Athletic Club is in the building and guests have access with your room key and photo id. My husband and son utilized the pool and enjoyed. The hotel was so quiet I felt like we were the only guests on our floor. The location is the best thing about the Homewood Suites. Whole Foods, Starbucks and a 24 hour CVs are within a block along with several restaurants. Little Italy and Inner Harbor are within 5 minutes. We had plans in Fells Point, which was about a 20 minute stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travel”
Reviews.Author: travelizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in October of 2011. The hotel was perfect for business travel. The suite - with a kitchenette (refrigerator, stovetop, microwave), living room, bedroom and bathroom - had all of the amenities I needed, including a full-size iron and hairdrier. The room was clean and quiet. Monday - Thursday night dinner is served 5-7pm, which was surprisingly good and incredibly convenient. Breakfast was served starting at 6am, which was very helpful, too. The location in Harbor East is perfect. You can walk to the Inner Harbor, Fells Point, Little Italy, or stay right in Harbor East, which has everything you need anyway (Whole Foods and CVS were great to have nearby). The Charm City Circulator, the free city bus in Baltimore, stops right near the hotel every 20 minutes or so. I would definitely recommend to business travelers. After trying several hotels in the Baltimore area for my business trips, this is definitely the hotel I will be using again.

Reviews.Title: “Well-run”
Reviews.Author: labrt2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well-run and met my expectations, with the exception of room size. The suites were tiny compared to other Homewood Suites I've stayed in. They were comfortable, but definitely on the cozy side. The sitting room felt rather cramped. But service was good, the staff was nice, and I was a fan of the kitchen amenities. Location is great--I was attending a conference at the Marriott across the street, and I think I got a better deal than the people staying there. It's a five minute walk to all the attractions of the Inner Harbor. Also, breakfast and the Welcome Home dinner were nice perks. There's no concierge, but the front desk staff made a good recommendation for dinner. Unfortunately, there's not much of a view from any of the rooms, but since I was hardly ever in the room, it didn't matter much.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suite”
Reviews.Author: SunHostResorts
Reviews.Content: Very nice suite , nice to have the kitchen and whole foods next door. Close to everything in inner harbor. Water taxi across street or close by foot

Reviews.Title: “One Good Staff Member without Support”
Reviews.Author: TommiNW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first Saturday in October and met my BFF and her husband whom we see once a year. I added the romantic getaway package to my room thinking that we would share the roses, the champagne, and the chocolate dipped strawberries with my friends before we headed out to dinner. OK - so maybe the computer knew we were a bunch of aging boomers and a senior. We arrived early (our friends also stayed the night before) around 11:30 am and our room wasn't ready (did not expect it to be but asked anyway). I asked when it would be ready and was told at around 3:00 pm. No problem - we went to lunch and the aquarium. We returned at 4:30 and the room wasn't ready. Megan, the staff at the front desk, gave us a room that was ready. I then asked if our romantic package would be moved to the new room. Megan looked quite bewildered that we even had the romantic package (it does show up on my confimation.) Megan went to the original room to check. No romantic package. She told me that the extra package price would be deducted from my bill. She also sent up around 7:30 pm a cheese and fruit platter which we didn't consume when we returned from dinner but did enjoy the fruit at breakfast the next morning. Also, when we arrived back at 4:30 pm, our friends room still hadn't been cleaned. In the morning when my billed showed up, the package had not been deducted. I called down to the front desk and explained about the charge and was placed on hold. After 5 minutes on hold, we decided to go to breakfast. When we got back from breakfast, I called the front desk again and finally got them to remove the package charge. The breakfast was mediocre with no cut-up fresh fruit so we appreciated the fruit platter we received the night before. Scrambled eggs were so-so, potatoes under cooked. The room was clean but I felt it was overpriced but that might be due to the area. It is a good location and walking distance to the aquarium and restaurants. BTW - on Sunday we went to the Railroad Museum and really enjoyed it. Next time, we will stay at the Hyatt or Marriott. This is the first Hilton run property I've stayed at that I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: My trips to this hotel is for medical reasons. Needless to say all the extra special attention the hotel staff provide me is a wonderful treat. Breakfast and dinner M - T make it an affordable hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms -- Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrews_Mommy
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. The rooms are all one bedroom apartments with a full kitchen, there's a free breakfast and Whole Foods is a block away. The hotel is ideally located and an easy walk to the Aquarium, Inner Harbor and Port DIscovery and the Science Museum. We love Baltimore and love spending the weekend here. Just wish it were a bit cheaper -- we usually stay at one of the lower cost hotels. But if I had the $$, this is where I'd stay everytime.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Quality at a 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olympia64
Reviews.Content: All hotel staff friendly, knowledgeable, and service oriented. Solid location, nice neighborhood; very close to water taxi, National Aquarium, USS Constellation, Little Italy, one mile from Oriole Park at Camden Yards. Superior fitness facility, hotel has use agreement with private fitness club (Mac fitness) so it is by no means your ordinary hotel fitness facility. Terrific pool area. Pool tip: On Sunday evening and possibly Saturday evening pool closes at 5:45 pm sharp. Open later during the workweek.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good price but stained carpets and furniture and breakfast rush turned us off”
Reviews.Author: Tourist20814
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel is perfect for the price, we got the room for $169 + tax for a night at the beginning of August. The location is simply the best. The staff could not be more friendly and accomodating. The decor is contemporary and everything looks new, but you can start to see the wear and tear in the rooms. Our room on the 11th floor was spacious but there was a big stain on the carpet and on the little sofa in the living room. The sofa does not have a pullout bed, by the way. And the beds are not queen, they are double beds (full), as they correctly publicize. They worked fine for us with are young kids, but you can tell the difference, when two people are trying to share a bed. The free breakfast has all the food you need. The quality is simply standard, but it seems like a mad rush, it is a little bit unsettling, everyone going back and forth from their tables to get more food or drinks. I want to say you definitely get what you paid for and this was still a great deal, but I know the chain can do a bit better with maintenance and to change the breakfast experience. People are looking for hotels with breakfast included, and the Homewood Suites could make this their trademark and be always on top in hotels this category...I'm rooting for them, as I was overall happy with my visit. Pool was another criteria for us but it was a short visit and we didn't have time, but they do have a that guests can use but that belongs to a health club in the same building...didn't sound very enticing but I suppose could be helpful for some especially during the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “This has the good and bad--”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda T
Reviews.Content: First the good: The staff was very friendly, and went out of their way to help us. The room was very clean, and the custodial staff did an outstanding job every day. Location was about 1/3-1/2 mile from major attractions like the Aquarium, and 1 and 1/3 mile from Camden Yard. There was plenty to do and see for our trip. The hot breakfast was excellent and much appreciated. The bad: There was no wall between the bedroom and the living room in our "suite." We thought a suite meant two rooms, allowing for some privacy (to protect the kids from Dad's snoring!) Since this was a family outing, we play and relax in the pool. The Taylor family was very disappointed to learn that the pool for this hotel is part of a fitness club -meaning serious swimmers doing laps, with no room for fun. The "fun" pool was tiny, and about 3 foot deep. Seriously disappointing. For this reason, I rated this stay good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Many Extras Included”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroESQ
Reviews.Content: For the price of a 3 star of 4 star hotel guests get a nicely appointed suite with a small kitchen and a separate seating area. They also get access to an very complete gym and wellness facility complete with a sauna, swimming pool, and state of the art exercise equipment. You also get a complimentary full breakfast and evening snacks/dinner including beer and wine Monday through Thursday. The hotel sits at a very trendy side of town and close to the best restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Very convenient location. The only downside is that it is understaffed and the parking options are ridiculously expensive. The staff that there is happens to be very nice and helpful, from the jack of all trades janitor/bellboy/late night housekeeper to the attendant at the evening reception who were always there to help. A truly good value for your money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: moose4580
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights while visiting the inner harbor area. The staff was very accomodating and the health club attached to the hotel is excellent. We were happy in every way with the stay and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: AssociationDude
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip, so we were concerned with stuff like the pool, the breakfast, the proximity to Inner Harbor area attractions. It all worked out very well. First, we didn't want to deal with a rental car and parking since we weren't planning on going anywhere too far. Came in from the airport by taking the Light Rail to the Convention Center and then hailing a cab to get to the hotel. Cost about $12 total for the four of us. Deal! Service at the desk was helpful and pleasant. It was 99F the two days we were there, so the water w/ lemon & ice next to check-in was almost always empty. The free "Charm City Circulator" stops about 1/2 block down the street, which was a convenient way to get to most tourist sites. It was about a 5-10 minute walk to the Aquarium. 1.5 blocks to Whole Foods and CVS. We had a suite with a king bed and a sofa sleeper. The kids (9 & 14) thought the sofabed was comfortable - an adult might disagree. When pulled out, it took up the entire room, so there was no where to put suitcases. We were in a room that came off the corner of the hallway, so the entrance hall was very long and the room dimensions may not have been typical. Had a partial view of some of the water, but mostly a view of the parking lot across the street. Full sized frig. My son doesn't like the noises of the big city (honking horns, sirens), so he noticed the noise at night but we didn't. Breakfast exceeded our expectations. The Sunday morning one was pretty extensive and they had lots of people refilling. Nearly overcrowded for seating but no one was left without a table. The breakfast on Monday morning was a little simpler, but still satisfied us. Regarding the pool and health club. The pool that you have access to is small - similiar to some Hampton Inn pools. The health club fitness equipment was top notch. We were treated well by the staff there. Just know that the hours aren't very long on the weekends, 6 pm if I remember correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jaelyn363
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and extremely big. They had a complete fitness center and the pool was olympic sized. Great Location next to the Harbour and was easy to access everything by foot. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oscart77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the first night of an extended road trip for a quick visit of Inner Harbor and Fell's Point. This hotel is equidistant from each, about a 15 minute walk. Our mini suite was well laid out and very clean. The carpet and sofa could have used a good shampooing, but I expect are doing well with the traffic encountered. We found the staff to be considerate and very helpful, a maintenance worker even welcomed us at the garage entrance and showed us to the front desk. As a few others have stated, the hotel is a little difficult to locate due to the unusual street situation. I believe the GPS location must be off also, since we were stopped 1/2 block away. The garage situation isn't too difficult to figure out once you're situated. We found this to be a great, convenient hotel and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder Stay, Lovely City”
Reviews.Author: OperaLady1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Homewood Suites Inner Harbor location. We were in Baltimore to check the city out before our daughter started at the Johns Hopkins School of Nursing. The location of the Hotel was perfect - on the Harbor, next to Little Italy and walking distance to Fells Point. The hotel provides free daily cab fare to and from Johns Hopkins, so that was a plus. And they offer a reduce rate to people visiting Johns Hopkins. We had a one bedroom suite for the three of us - husband, myself and grown daughter. It was very comfortable and not crowded. I'm a bedding diva - I want a soft, comfortable bed, plush pillows, high thread count sheets and Homewoods delivered. While the breakfast was better than a continental, though not what I would call a full breakfast, it was very good and varied each day. The guy that ran the breakfast (wish I remembered his name) was excellent. He went out of his way to provide a good experience - like "taking" fresh fruit from the restaurant. We also used room service on a couple of occasions and the food was great. I really can't think of any negatives other than paying for parking, but that is a given in Baltimore. There is even an Enterprise Car Rental practically across the street. I would certainly go back and stay again or recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for (family) business and work-out”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: Spacious and well-equiped suites near the waterside. Decent service and a more-than-sufficient-equiped gym/swimming pool. Shop good be a little larger in choices. Pity that there is a lot of information on the environment, but that the housekeeping switches on the dishwasher for a single pot and a cup. Good cleaning services overall. The status of carpet and the outlook of the hallways good be improved. Efficient staff, friendly but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but, bellhop tried to steal from my wallet.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia4224
Reviews.Content: We went for my son's college graduation and stayed 3 nights and most of the experience was good. Except when I was checking in, the bell hop who was ever so anxious to carry my bags into my room tried to take cash from my pocketbook that I left on the counter. I never reported it, because I came in the room from the hallway and he quickly put it down. It was bothering me that I never said anything, because I was too shocked at the time. Everthing else was fine at the hotel. Just never leave your wallet unattended!

Reviews.Title: “This is a real jewel in the harbor area”
Reviews.Author: Winkelreid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this suite hotel for three nights two weeks ago and were charmed with the whole experience. First, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful; we asked them to mail letters and packages by Fedex and it couldn't have been simpler. The suite was clean and bright with a fully equipped kitchen and door to separate the bedroom from the living area. There were lots of towels and there was a guest coin laundry which came in handy for our later travels. They cleaned the room while we were out for only 35 minutes! The complimentary breakfast was great but we missed the evening wine and food reception due to our schedule. We definitely recommend it and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel itself was good but run like a circus”
Reviews.Author: attorneyfromatlanta
Reviews.Content: Ok we were only there from Wed to Sat, but we were locked out of our room three times. The room was fine, except the toilet didn't flush every time, and it ran on and on. My husband took off the top and there was duck tape and all kinds of evidence of an attempt to gerry rig it so that it would work. Well we lived with it for a day and then I called the front desk for maintenance. They sent someone but when I returned to the room, my door was propped open with no man in sight. I called the front desk because we did have valuables in the room, such as my husband's lap top. They sent me the head of maintenance and he came and apologized, told me the workman must have gone for a part. Well we were in the room for the next 30 to 45 minutes and he never came back. I told them I expected them to have a pass key, so that leaving my door open was unnecessary. The first night of our stay, my husband and I were in bed asleep and someone tried to enter our room, with a key, knocking and pushing the door. I finally got up and we had used the little bar and thank god we did because it was three quarters pushed open and barely hanging on. Then the front desk called us, and asked who we were, they didn't have us in that room on the computer so they gave our room to other guests, who were trying to enter. I called them again and confirmed who we were. Now this is at 11:15-11:30 at night. So the next morning, I went to breakfast as I had a conference that started early in the a.m. and took only my key. When I returned to the room, I was locked out. This was the first lock out. They told me because they gave our room to someone else last night, the computer locked us out The desk clerk asked for id which I told her was locked in my room. She asked me the address etc to confirm my identity then re-keyed my key. Another morning we were locked out and then on our final day, she gave us a late check out as our plane didn't leave until later in the day. Pronto we were locked out and had to get our keys re-keyed so we could do our final packing, as we had left to have a leisurely lunch and were now in danger of not getting out of there in time. Finally, when I got the final bill they charged me for parking for three days. I didn't have a car so that was impossible. The clerk insisted someone had parked in the garage under my name. I told her that was not possible unless someone at her desk had given my name to someone. She took it off but I thought it strange unless an employee parked under my name. No one else knew I was there. The room was great. The breakfast was fine and the light dinner was a lifesaver because I found the surrounding restaurants expensive. Lunch in the area was $20 and that was for a sandwich. The asian restaurant nearby was not bad and we made it to Miss Shirley's which is recommended, and it was good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Could be Better”
Reviews.Author: mjzPa
Reviews.Content: Arrived here for a weekend stay. Had booked a 1 BR King suite, but requested double beds at the front desk and after a bit of checking they accomodated. What they did not tell me was that the rate would be an extra $60/night which I found out at checkout. Brought this up to the front desk clerk and she basically said it is what it is. Room was very dated with stains on the carpet and furnishings seemed to be missing. There was no chair for the desk and no table for a coffe table of any sort. Beds were comfortable enough and bathroom was a decent size. Did take the opportunity to use the complimentary fitness facility and pools attached to the hotel which was a great perk. Breakfast was pretty bad the first morning and just ok the next; however the staff at breakfast was very nice. All in all would stay somewhere else based on the change in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has potential but needs new management now”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaD
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We were meeting with a group of associates and we made reservations for all. Two were not in the system and major hassle to get them on. No one seemed to be in charge of our meeitng room. I had to find someone to help us with flipchart paper, etc. Middle of the first night, fire alarm. Walked down 9 stories to sit on curb outside. No announcements, no fire engines, nothing. Sat for almost an hour in the hotel front.no one came to tell us anything. Finally, for no apparent reason, everyone started going inside. A security person came up to us and asked, why is everyone coming in? Is the GM out there? We said no and he said we were not supposed to come in, rushed away frazzled. No announcement so we sat in the lobby. No one ever told us anything. In the meantime, no alarm went off in two of our associates rooms and they slept through the whole thing. Great. One morning, no carafe or basket or creamer with the coffee set up. One morning no hot water for showers. Took three calls to get everything so that we could have coffee. The woman at the desk didn't understand what I was asking for so that was difficult too. The self parking cost $30 since I left 25 hours after arriving. Valet is $32 for in and out as many times as one wants. If you're going to be there more than 24 hours, valet. The furniture is a bit worn and needs a bit of cleaning. The hotel bills were screwed up when we went to leave. This hotel is in a great location and has the potential to be really nice . . . but I was frustrated and unhappy by the time we got out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with clean, comfortable and large 1 bedroom suite, including full kitchen.”
Reviews.Author: cam80
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is well located for easy walking to many attractions and neighborhoods. Rooms are very clean. King suite had large living room with full size pull out sofa bed. Full kitchen is nice, although we didn't use it. Access to amazing private gym,(free), although not the hotel"s, it's adjoining. Valet parking advised, but it's $38.per day with in/out privileges. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good stay...will find somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: StefCentralVA
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Homewood Suites Inner Harbor in Baltimore for the Day Out with Thomas the Tank Engine at the B&O Railroad Museum. Checking in was awkward with the way the hotel is set up on the street, but it was easy. We originally booked a 2 Queen one bedroom suite. Upon check in, we were told they were out. We had booked a month in advanc, so this was news to us. So we ended up with a King one bedroom suite. That's fine. The child can sleep on the pull out couch bed. We checked into our room to find it ULTRA tiny. The picture online make it seem quite spacious. It is not. It is rather cramped with a lot of wasted hallway space. The bathroom and dressing area are very cramped and once the pull out sofa is pulled out, it is the entire living room. This room was not designed to accomodate more than two people comfortably, and certainly not a couple with a small child. The rooms were very clean, and I was glad to have the kitchen. I was not aware that the pillows and comforters were down. If I had, I would have requested a down free room. The air conditioning was very odd and it was difficult to get it cooler in the room. The complimentary hot breakfast downstairs was a very nice perk with very friendly staff. Front desk staff used profanity upon my checking out when I laughingly described the fit that my child was throwing because we were having to leave. That was awesome. Thank you for using the 'P' word right there in the front of a very nice hotel. Yes, my child was 'pissed' but you didn't need to keep saying that over and over again. Glad he was not in the room at the time. Internet was good once you got the right connection. I kept getting the Hilton Garden Inn site rather than the Homewood Suites site. For the price...I will find another property next time. If you are travelling alone, or just a couple...Yes. For families. Not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized stay at an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cliftonduo925
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that next time if we can't stay at the Hampton Inn, we will stay at another hotel chain. We stayed here for my birthday weekend and had no idea it was a Baltimore vs NY. They overbooked at both sides of the joined hotels and the service was deplorable. We requested a crib a week before we got there, had to ask again at checkin. An hour later, no crib , 3.5 hours and 4 calls later we finally get the crib. My son had an accident so we needed a new top sheet and comforter- couldn't get it because apparently they don't have enough linens! When they finally did the guy pounded on the door and tossed them at me when I opened up the door. So we made our own bed. Next day, no housekeeping until nearly 4 and when they did come they left the dirty stuff half in the room, half in front of the room. We got no hand towels or wash clothes. I call down and apparently they don't have enough towels to go around because of how booked they are. When I got a hold of the front desk manager she did offer to return a small amount of the points we used to stay but it didn't even equal 1 nights points it costed to stay. Parking cost us 64 bucks which is ridiculous! Honestly it really messed up my birthday weekend and I am considering writing corporate. I'd find another place to stay which is a same because it is a nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel - disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: pd6050
Reviews.Content: Furnishings and rug in the room were stained, old, and worn. First, I requested a non smoking room when I made the reservation. When I checked in all they had were smoking rooms. Second, when I went to bed there was something in the bed between the mattress pad the the sheet. To my disgust it was an old bloody condom. UGH!! I was ready to go home at that point. Will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for one thing...”
Reviews.Author: mouthspe717
Reviews.Content: I met some business associates this past weekend (April 16-17) at this hotel. I have to admit I liked almost everything about it. The location is great, the fact they have a pub/restaurant attached is convenient, and I think the rates are comparable to the surrounding areas. My issue with this hotel is the parking rates. It is about $50 to park from Friday-Sunday. I am supposed to stay at this hotel again this weekend (family trip this time), but I am just not sure about having to pay fees like that to park my car. I will certainly provide more feedback as I learn more about this parking situation.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY - Worst service on planet earth!”
Reviews.Author: goodyweaver
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience was just plain ridiculous. To start, we arrived to find another family in front of us with the mom in tears because they couldn't honor their reservation - apparently they overbook the rooms at this place. So this family - with 6 kids - was sent over to the Marriott. My husband and I had 3 kids with us, so we were worried at this point. And rightly so. The desk clerk told us that she didn't have our room available either. But we could have a smaller room if we wanted it. Not wanting to trudge to the Marriott with 3 kids at 7pm, we took it. The front desk person told us that they don't guarantee rooms that are booked online. Nice. In 2011 this place can't guarantee your room if you book ONLINE??? Whatever. Upon first glance, the room was ok. Till we noticed the musty, smoky smell and stained furniture. On top of not having the room we paid for available, they gave us a smoking room when we specifically reserved nonsmoking due to my very bad allergies and for the kids' health. My husband complained, but they said again that no other rooms were available. They sent a custodian up, who promptly started spraying air freshener all over the place - great for allergies, of course. At least he was extremely nice and apologetic - he left an "air purifier" that didn't do much. The one thing I can say for this place is that the free breakfast is great - lots of selection and everything was hot and decent. You would think that once we checked out, the crappy time was over. But no. I started getting weird random charges on the card I used to check in. Especially weird because they are from the Hilton Garden Hotel, which is connected to the suites - but where we did NOT stay. Neither the accountant nor the managers at the hotel(s) have any idea why these charges are on my account. So on top of everything else I now have to deal with fraudulent charges on my credit card and the (hopefully) temporary loss of $150 in my bank account.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this hotel!! Come back every year!!! THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniblevins1921
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have went to this hotel once a year since it opened as our belated Valentines day getaway. We love it so much, I would never ever dream of even looking for another hotel in B-more! The hotel is spotless, the staff is wonderful, the rooms are spacious, beds are super comfy, location is great and the breakfast is yummy!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Winter Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamily004
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of Homewood Suites... it is a part of the Hilton Chain. It was a nice surprise! We booked a King Studio and we were upgraded to a larger room w/views of the Inter Harbor. The room had a full kitchen w/dishwasher. A full hot breakfast was included in the rate and free entrance to the MAC aquatic club. Perfect winter getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Updating previous review--things have changed”
Reviews.Author: gfbarch
Reviews.Content: Wrote a glowing review of this hotel one year ago. Our most recent return visit showed many changes--large staff turnover, rooms had stained cushions and food offered with the room charge was very poor quality--all with a significant price hike. Not sure what is going on but staff clearly are stressed with much to do. This is sad for us because it is very convenient to Johns Hopkins and the previous visits have good memories for us. Let's hope things improve.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninanancy
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was huge and I really enjoyed how close it was to Whole Foods, CVS and right next door to the movie theaters. The pool was weird. It is not the hotel's pool, it belongs to a health club. So it was awkward to use and we only stayed for a little bit. The breakfast food was great. Except they put pizza sauce in one of the egg dishes. The hotel is situated right near a bus stop for the free bus...if you are budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nitawil
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend stayed in a suite here for one night while we were in Baltimore, and we loved it!! The room was so spacious, comfortable, and clean. We really felt at home and were sorry that we were there for only one night. We even though about extending our stay, because we really did feel at home. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again if I'm ever in the area. It's also very close to the National Aquarium and other attractions. Lots of great places to eat in the area....check out the Leabanese Taverna. Great food, decor, and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Walking Distance to anywhere in the Harbor, Little Italy and Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: vacationlady1
Reviews.Content: We took the subway into Baltimore to avoid the high parking fees and traffic and congestion for New Years eve. The subway is only about 6 blocks from the hotel (Shot Tower). The hotel is located about a block from Pier 6, great location to the Harbor, Little Italy and Fells Point. We were able to walk everywhere and was glad we rode the subway due to the amount of traffic in the city. Checkin was a breeze (when you enter the lobby there is a line for Homewood Suites and Hilton Garen Hotel). We were given a one bedroom suite located on the 9th floor. The room was clean with no complaints. Typical Homewood Suites with the kitchen, living room and bedroom. The view was spectular of the city (especially at night with it lite up.) We were able to watch the traffic coming into the city from 83 which was very heavy. We were able to walk out of the hotel and go about two blocks to McCormick & Schmicht to watch the fireworks along with water edge which were spectular. We went back to the room immediately afterwards and were glad we choose to stay in the city and not have to deal with the traffic. My only complaint was hearing a band until about 2 in the morning. I read about this problem on the board and was not expecting to hear it with being on the 9th floor, but since we were up so late it was not as bothersome as if we would have went to bed earlier. The breakfast the next morning was one of the best we have had at a Homewood Suites. Everyone we ran into at the hotel was very pleasant. It was a very enjoyable stay and would look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed w/ husband while he was there for work”
Reviews.Author: grapebgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in Baltimore over Halloween weekend & I came for the weekend since he was there for work for 2 weeks. He stayed in a suite which was great! The room was spacious & clean! No bed bugs! I checked! Free breakfast in the morning was plentiful & since it was a weekend, lots of staff there to keep up on cleaning & refilling food! The bed was very comfy & parking was comparable even though I feel expensive! This was also a great location. once I parked my car, never drove again until I left! We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure at Homewood Suites!”
Reviews.Author: josi1968
Reviews.Content: Our stay was like any other we've had at Homewood Suites... wonderful! The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room had a small, but appreciated, view of Inner Harbor. Breakfast was good, as usual. We just had a nice stay and I'm glad we chose Homewood Suites again - this time in Baltimore. Just a few words of "note" to pickier guests: the breakfast area is gotten to by going to "Homewood Lodge" in the elevator - the rear doors open. It is staffed by only a few, so when it's busy, please expect that some things might need to be refilled, but they do it as quickly as possible and will get it for you right away if you ask. The pool is kind of an issue, but not really. I'd read people complain about it because you can only use the splash pool and hot tub and not the lap pools. This is true (because the fitness center and pools are actually a fitness club's property), but is that really a big deal? I will say the "taste" of the splash pool was gross (salty, like sweat), but the pool is clean and we had a great time (just sucked it up and dealt with it). The lifeguard was really, REALLY super nice and we had fun - but also note that you should go ALL THE WAY through the gym to get to the pool if you have children as they are not allowed to go through the changing rooms. Another thing I didn't know that has nothing to do with Homewood Suites is that parking is VERY VERY EXPENSIVE in Baltimore. Do your homework and try to get discounts. I did use the hotel's parking garage with in/out privileges and it was $26/day (they charge you by how many nights you stayed), though that rate could change. You can easily walk to most of the pier properties. I walked to the aquarium and I have very, very bad legs. It was a nice day though and we went slowly and enjoyed the walk. Cabs are available, but if you're going to do that, you might as well drive and park close to where you want to be. It costs the same ($6-7 over, $6-7 back vs. $7-15 for parking). Another note that will change based on what's going on... LOTS of sirens one night, not the other and jack-hammering in the a.m. (after 9 a.m. Sunday) due to construction on the street below. Big city - expect things like that now and then.

Reviews.Title: “With a few changes... Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: dr-criv
Reviews.Content: This is the 6th HS property at which we have stayed. The location is superb. On the east side of the harbor on the fringe of Little Italy and walking distance to Fells Point and the Inner Harbor. James Joyce Irish Pub across the street is a great watering hole with a fun Irish band at night. It was packed, unlike any other location we frequented over this beautiful weekend, so it is seemingly popular for a reason! The front desk staff was great. The property is odd in that the lobby and common areas are shared with the Hilton Garden Inn. The rooms are smaller than any other HS property we have seen. The parking garage, which is $26 a day, is attached to the hotels. The biggest negative is the breakfast. Understaffed, spilled food all over the floor, styrofoam coffee cups which did not have fitting lids resulting in a change of clothes, cold potatoes and undercooked and cold bacon, a breakfast egg scramble which was way too funky to eat (scrambled eggs anyone?), overripe bananas, no English muffins, bread was stale. Although the hotel was not that crowded, the buffet was continuously out of plates and napkins. As for the rooms, the shower is unlit and is dark when the curtain is pulled. I had to call the desk to locate the hairdryer (in a black bag in the closet obscured by the ironing board) although there is cabinetry under the sink which was empty. Finally, the bill was left in the hallway not slipped under the door. It contained my name, home address, Hilton Honors # and confirmation number. That is crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and functional rooms, clean and attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsadoreG
Reviews.Content: Pluses were a large room even by Homewood Suites standards. Room was very clean, tasteful and nicely laid out. There was ample furniture for relaxing and fine toiletries. We stayed for four days and it could not have been more pleasant. Breakfast although we ate little was still plentiful. Internet both wired and wireless were free and worked at ample speed. Minuses -the staff was largely silent after a nice greeting the first day. Basically just shuffling around. The coffee and plastics in our room was not always replaced and the bed was a bit too soft for our liking but that is a matter of preference. In summary, the hotel could pay attention to a few small things (like having a luggage cart in front and the above) but for the most important areas, such as cleaniness, amenities, comfort etc. they did fine. Parking is expensive in the entire Baltimore city area and should be factored in when pricing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: OshieMichigan
Reviews.Content: We had a block of rooms for a wedding. Not one of the guests had a negative comment about this hotel. The rooms were nice. The staff friendly. I dealt with the hotel's group event people and they were always helpful and responsive. The location is great. Easy walk to the harbor area and water taxi. CVS and Whole Food located just a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: carreraboo
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel is great, the service leaves much to be desired. The floor of our hotel smelled of cigarette smoke and the beds were very uncomfortable. Our room was not cleaned during our weekend stay. On Saturday night, we were woken up by the hotel's fire alarm at 2 AM. After the fire department cleared the building we returned to our room, only to be woken up an hour later. This time, after trudging down seven flights of stairs at 3 AM, we were told that they were in the process of resetting the alarm. The front desk staff did not offer an apology for the inconvenience and told us that we needed to be understanding. Over the next two hours the fire alarm went off several more times. We called down to the front desk to confirm that we were safe to stay in our room. Our concerns were only met with an unfriendly request to be patient with the situation. I realize that the staff was probably overwhelmed, but that is not an excuse to be short mannered with guests. Upon check out the next morning, the front desk staff did not mention the events of the night before. The hotel never expressed their apologies or regrets that we had a stressful and sleepless night in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: takingahike
Reviews.Content: I struggle to find an area for the hotel to improve. The suite was beautiful and clean. The employees were professional and polite. The location is fantastic. The value for the cost was excellent: free Internet, free extensive breakfast, free dinner (Mon - Thurs) with beer and wine, and use of the neighboring health club.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury home from home”
Reviews.Author: oovj
Reviews.Content: We stayed three weeks in a pleasantly air conditioned, well equipped, suite. The kitchen had dishwasher, microwave, cooker, fridge/freezer. The rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Laundry rooms on 3,5 and 7 mean you can travel light. They have your safety covered - they do drills! The recreational facilities, gym/pools/jaccousie/computer room are free to guests and easily accesible. Oh, I niss that pool!!! And the regulars even talked to me :) Complimentary breakfast was always good - plenty of choice and available to take to your room if you ask for a carton. (I started making hash browns now...) Starbucks is next door too - if you want to sleep in and have a latte. The hotel restaurant does good food. There's an EXCELLENT Fusion place next door called Talara's!! an Irish bar opposite witha selection of Bushmills Whiskey (16yr malt ;) Little Italy is around the corner. The free bus stops outside MasonLegg just on the circle. Harbour East Water Taxi is 2 minutes walk and that will take you everywhere all day for $10. The Inner Harbour is 10/15 minutes walk. Our view was superb from floor 11. Can I come back please?

Reviews.Title: “Very Good & Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJbuffalo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel situated in the East Harbor within walking distance of Inner Harbor, Little Italy restaurants, and a little longer walk to Fells Point. Suite was nice, good bed, clean, and one of the quietest hotel rooms I have ever had. Free breakfast was good with excellent service. Free draft beer and wine happy hour. Front desk help were friendly and provided accurate directions to one attraction I visited during my 4 day conference. Minor issue with slow bathroom drains. Odd hotel because both Homewood Suites and the Hilton Garden Inn are in the same building, sharing a front desk. If your cab driver or shuttle service doesn't know where one hotel is - they may know the other. Nice mid priced restaurant/irish pub across the street. If you are returning to BWI airport I would suggest taking a taxi $30 + tip. Shuttle service was unreliable from this location because a prior shuttle stop is a large conference hotel. Although I had a shuttle reservation I waited 45 min - then had to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsksss
Reviews.Content: The suite cost $189 per night, but you got a FULL breakfast & dinner that made the cost more reasonable. The breakfast included eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, cereal, french toast, fruit, etc. One night for dinner we had red & white wine plus beer. The dinner included salad, soup, the main meal, sides & dessert (ccokies). The food was for all guests, not just the ones there for business. The monthly menu was posted on the fridge in the room. This is the first time I've been to a hotel that gave you dinner! The hotel is a few long blocks from the Inner Habor, but it is walkable with confortable shoes. I throughly enjoyed my stay! P.S. After checkout time we stored our luggage at the hotel for no extra fee & went shopping. When we returned the staff retrieved our luggage & we went home.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mtandhpd
Reviews.Content: I called the day before and explained that I was travelling with my husband and 2 year old and that if there was any way we could check in earlier than the standard 3pm check in time it woud be greatly appreciated. I was told that they could not make any promises, but would make a note and try to fulfill my request. When we arrived at 9:30am the next morning, they had a room waiting for us! It made our stay so much easier. Great location. Loved being in a clean, safe area within walking distance to the Inner Harbor. Having a Whole Foods next store was a plus. The complimentary happy hour during the week was really nice. Complimentary hot breakfast was good, especially the waffles. Room was clean. Bed was comfy. Looks like most rooms have partial view of Inner Harbor (ours did). Had a convenient business center where we were able to print out boarding passes. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: trvl2
Reviews.Content: The staff at this Homewood Suites was terrific. Check-in at the front desk took about a minute and the desk clerk was very welcoming. Several staff in the lobby at various times, including a cleaning lady, stopped to say hello and please enjoy my stay. The folks working at the breakfast and cocktail hour were exceedingly friendly and very helpful. A manager (it seemed) greeted us and told us to please enjoy our food. An older gentleman helped himself to the entire plate of chocolate chip cookies (!) and carried a spilling glass of wine, filled to the brim, over the carpet to his table. The staff was very nice to him, calling him 'sir', asking him if there was anything they could get him, and bringing his special request right away from the kitchen. (I would have kicked him to the curb, myself. He was being quite a piggie.) The room was very nice. It was a corner room, so maybe nicer than a regular room. Very clean. Nice view of Inner Harbor, although it is too bad the Hopkins Business School building is in front, blocking the view. Convenient location. Would love to stay here again. My impression was that this hotel must be very well managed and the staff happy to work here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: gfbarch
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel while my husband receives treatment at Johns Hopkins. A great value and the food is excellent. Accommodations come with a guest membership to the adjoining MAC gym which is top class. All of our stays have been exceptional--we have stayed at this hotel for about 30 days this year. The staff treated us like family. Can't say enough good things about the place. And it is convenient to the harbor, great restaurants, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: TravelPitt
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. It's a very nice, clean, safe neighborhood that a very "new" feel to it. Nice stores nearby, a coffee shop and theater basically connected to the hotel. It was a pleasant, maybe 10-15 minute walk to the Aquarium and all of the sites in that area. Service was fantastic. After getting back home, I realized I had left my laptop and its bag under the bed. I called the hotel, they found the bag and laptop and sent it back to me without charging me for shipping. Our room was on the end which, while it was a far walk from the elevator, ended up being nice because our room was laid out in a more open arrangement that some of our traveling companions. It was really, very spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate. I will give some very small negatives... there weren't enough towels for each of us to use more than one per day but it was easily fixed by the cleaning staff. Parking really is a bit tricky to find (it's around the building on the street behind the front entrance, next to a chocolate shop) and paying was a bit confusing. Basically, if you're just parking your car and not moving it, don't put the parking charge on your hotel bill, just pay at the ATM-like machine when you leave. If you need to be in and out, then let the hotel charge you. Again, it is a little confusing but easily explained by the front desk staff. If we ever find ourselves in Baltimore again, we will absolutely stay at this hotel. No need to even look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but some minor problems”
Reviews.Author: mylittleguy
Reviews.Content: As per the hotel's recommendation we called early in the morning on our arrival to request a pack and play as we were arriving late that evening. It wasn't there and the first one was broken; the second one was flimsy. The manager offered us complementary museum tickets (which was a nice offer.) After unpacking, we realized there was no tub as it was a handicapped acceptable room. They offered us another room but we were already unpacked so we stayed. Compared to other hotel experiences, we were somewhat disappointed that the staff was not able to provide many recommendations of things to do/places to eat and did not always respond to requests for items in a timely fashion. On a positive note, the location was great, it was quiet despite being in the city, the breakfast was nice, and the room was clean and an ample size suite.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: flyinganchor86
Reviews.Content: I took my family to this hotel on our first trip to Baltimore and we had a pleasant time there. The lobby and room were clean and spacious. Hotel staff including concierge and reception desk were very pleasant and helpful. The suites are especially suitable for tight families. In my case, we had a 1 year old baby who shared the King bed with me and my wife, while the 12 year old took the pullout sleeper which was pretty comfortable. The room also had a kitchen who found useful for feeding the baby with formula. The only negative thing I can think of is that the breakfast area is a little small and crowded. We couldn't find an empty table when we went down to have breakfast and it seems the tables were not cleaned up fast enough. One thing to watch out is the parking. The parking garage is connected to the hotel, but the entrance is on another street on the back of the hotel. The problem was that on that street there were many parking garages and there was no sign to indicate which one is for the hotel. I ended up getting into a wrong one and had to call the hotel to figure out which garage was for the hotel. Overall, it's a pretty good hotel for family stay. Its location is also pretty good, a few minutes of walk to the aquarium and other activities on the harbor front. I will probably stay at this hotel again next time I go there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: dls1656
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Inner Harbor in the past for recreation, I was a little nervous about spending a week in Baltimore as a solo traveler. My fears were for naught. This area of the Harbor is so clean and nice, and there wasn't one single moment, that I didn't feel safe! My home away from home was everything that I needed; kitchen, desk, free Wifi, great bed with lots of pillows, and I even had a small harbor view outside of my window. For the non-discriminating eater, there is free food offered on the 2nd floor; breakfast in the morning, and a very small dinner selection M-Th between 5-7 with self service wine and tap beer. There are lots of restaurant choices within walking distance for both lunch and dinner. James Joyce, the Irish Pub across the street has great food - I enjoyed their grilled cajun chicken ceasar salad so much, I went back a 2nd time for it! For those who prefer to save a few bucks and utilize their kitchen, there is a Whole Foods Market conveniently located right around the corner, and a liquor store on that same block. As others have mentioned, there is a Starbucks, Haagen Dazs, and Movie Theater, right outside the Hotel's front entrance. After enjoying dinner at Phillips Seafood, we stopped at Dicks Last Resort for drinks on the way back and that's a fun restaurant/bar for adults to enjoy... they even had live music. All in all, I was so satisfied with this location and my accommodations, that when returning to the IH in the future for our trips to the ballpark, we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but”
Reviews.Author: ck111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and good for the price, overall. In the same building is the Hilton Garden Inn. Let's start with the positives. They offer a free, hot breakfast every morning.
