Scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage...the works. They also offer free drinks and a dinner meal Monday through Thursday. The room was clean. The sheets were clean. No body hair in the bathroom or on the toilet, which is something that irks me about some places. There is a refrigerator, two burner stove, microwave and dishwasher in every room. And it is so close to the Inner Harbor that there is no reason to drive there. Short walk and you are in the center of it all. Also a short walk to Little Italy. The neighborhood where the hotel is located is very nice and safe. It's also very low key in the evenings and at night. No loud kids or teenagers running amok. Families, business people, etc. Very nice. But, as with many hotels, the cleaning staff is normally from another country and English tends not to be their primary language, however, they can usually understand what you are saying. From the day we arrived, we had to call the front desk everyday to get more wash cloths. There were my husband and I, our teenager and our infant. So we atleast needed three cloths, as I brought the baby's from home. But everyday we would arrive back at our room to find 1 or 2. The one day I caught up with the maid she had no idea what I was saying when I said wash cloth. She tried to give me soap, shampoo and a hand towel. Also, we tip everybody...the housekeeping, maintenance (when they had to come twice to replace light bulbs), and even the people who brought us our wash cloths. And one time I said enough is enough...why are we tipping the person who brings us our wash cloths when we didn't get them the first time around? So the guy who brought them asked us 2 more times if there was anything else we needed or he could get us until my husband finally gave him a dollar. And he smiled and left. Also, they have one washer and dryer on three floors only...and there are twelve floors. So many times when you go to do your laundry you have to go up and down the floors to see which dryer is empty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BrettWheeler
Reviews.Content: I've had nothing but good experiences with Homewood Suites, and I think my best experience with them was in Baltimore. The rooms are big, spacious, tidy, and homey. The furniture was comfortable, the view was great, and the staff was very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: essmith5
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel. Overall was a very good experience. The location is good and the rooms are pretty spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Location in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMember
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel which follows the Hilton/Homewood template, consequently the facility is current. It is centrally located in the eastern harbor district and convenient to the Inner Harbor and Fells Point historic district. It is surrounded by numerous dining options (Pazo is notable) as well as a Whole Foods across the street which offers numerous prepared food alternatives. The eastern harbor business association provides a very visible security street presence which keeps out some of the more seedy elements you often find in other parts of the city center. In addition, the association maintains a “Clean Team” staff which keeps the district litter free. Net, net it is Baltimore’s most patron friendly hotel setting. This was my second stay. The hotel suites and mini-suites are outfitted with kitchenettes although there was a notable absence of accessories, for example, paper towels, dishwasher soap, etc. The furnishings are not elaborate yet they are comfortable. There is a pleasant exterior garden and fountain located on the facility’s eighth floor. The hotel offers free internet access and a complimentary breakfast which can be quite crowded. Parking is available at an adjacent facility at a per diem of $22.00 if you pay at the automated teller otherwise the hotel will charge you $25.00 per diem to add it to your hotel bill. The front end service was inconsistent and ranged from professional to one night clerk who came with serious attitude. The hotel’s location and price point make this a good alternative for your Baltimore stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Willabe
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect choice for my family, so glad we decided to stay here. It was within walking distance to all of the Inner Harbor attractractions included a continental breakfast, heated pool, free wi-fi, and very friendly staff, all at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The best hospitality I have experienced...It was exactly what we needed after spending all day at the hospital.”
Reviews.Author: pageforhelp
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Renaissance and Marriott Waterfront ,all very nice but nothing like the homewood suites. We checked our luggage in at 0430 since we needed to report to surgical suite at John Hopkins hospital at 05oo for our son's surgery, we asked for a late check-in because we knew it would be a long day for us. Since our son could not have visitors for 2 hours we checked in and were able to browse the amenities. Our 1 king size suite was perfect..a kitchenette supplied with microwave,stovetop,dishwasher,full size refrigator,dishes,dish towels,pots and pans,bar barstools,sofa-bed #1 large plasma tv screen,king size bed with #2 large tv plasma screen, sink and vanity separate from toliet and tub so everyone can get ready without sharing same space. Pool table, library,dining room with excellent free breakfast, entertainment room with bar included with is relaxing at night with lit candles in sitting area, computer area and marvelous gym next door. The free taxi vouchers make it so easy to visit the John Hopkins hospital, it take about 5 minutes by taxi so if there is any emergency, you can be there very quickly. The staff is so caring and helpful especially they are aware of your needs while visiting family at he hospital. The gift shops has about any little things you need. Starbucks is next door to the hotel, then the lovely movie theater, great irish pub across the street,cvs drug store and whole foods grocer within 2 minute walk from the hotel. When we return for another f/u appointment, we will reserve our stay with Homewood suites. I could not been more impressed with the wonderful hospitality we were provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: BlueBirdDay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of April 2010. I traveled back to visit Baltimore, where I lived most of life, to visit my hometown w/a husband who pretty much shunned city life. But I wasn't going to give up staying in the city for a bit. He loved it. We were on the back end of the hotel, 2 stories above a grassy private area w/a fountain (5 stories up technically) so noise was NOT an issue at all. I loved the fact we could walk out the front door to the aquarium, shopping, little italy etc. I also loved the fact that "Harbor East" area has been so renovated and built up w/fancy hotels/restaurants/shopping that your safety is not really in question. The hotel is across the street from a police sub station and there is numerous hired security in the general area. It is also right next to a Whole Foods for shopping to stock your mini kitchen in your suite. The $25 a day parking can be a little hard to take, but we needed a car. If you are just staying in the city, you don't need a car as public transportation/walking/cabbing/airport shuttle is always available. The parking is not owned by the hotel, but I felt perfectly safe in the garage as we had an elevator directly to our hotel. Actually, I can honestly say it was probably the cleanest parking garage I have ever been in. The suite w/two rooms was honestly smaller than we thought, especially w/a pack and play, but that's ok. Front Desk staff was VERY busy but helpful if you needed them. They brought milk and some other things right up to our room when we arrived the first night after the dinner closed. The one down side? The free breakfast/dinners during the week were really nothing to speak of. They had stuffed flounder on their menu for the weeknight we were there and it ended up being plain pasta w/red sauce. It was fine to feed our toddler, lucky we were planning to have crabs that night anyway. The breakfast eggs were cakey and bacon see through - but then again, you can't complain when its free. Take it or leave it. And there were other options such as cereal/fruits etc. Also, I know from living in the city that the pool privledges aren't those in the large pool shown - its simply a little plunge pool for hotel guests at the MAC. So don't depend on swimming laps w/o putting down some extra cash for a day pass.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay at with small toddlers”
Reviews.Author: Shoper
Reviews.Content: I am just highlighting the points that stuck out but overall, I highly recommend this place particularly if traveling with children. Even without kids, I think the price was great for location and room cleanliness/features. GOOD points (not in any order): -includes dinner M-Th -pool/gym access -real one bedroom suite with TV in each area -SUPER location; walkable to all sites -very friendly, helpful, professional front desk (very responsive) -includes a great daily buffet breakfast -good sized rooms (for 2 adults, 2 tots (2 yo and 5 yo) -cookies at the front desk around check in time -clean rooms -Whole Foods is a block away for snacks/healthy food options BAD points (pretty minor though): -not enough towels for 4 in bathroom (but got them quickly enough) -not enough kids channels and no DVD player -parking is $22/day (but it could have been worse) -breakfast/dinner can get crowded (so early is key) -not luxurious by any means (but really great for families and who can enjoy luxury with toddlers?) -our specific room had some bathroom drainage issues; ended up with a wet floor after a shower -noise from the street does carry a bit; we were on the sixth floor and with curtains pulled open, you can hear some traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “Compromise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: movies29
Reviews.Content: I had shopped Inner Harbor hotels and the high prices and the "car got broken into" stories made me look elsewhere. The location of this one was a compromise I was willing to make. It is behind the hulking Marriot, no view and a pleasant 10 minute walk over two foot bridges to reach the aquarium. This leads to the east side of the large horseshoe that is the harbor. On the other hand, Little Italy is on the right side of the hotel and Fells Point is behind it. There is a lot going on in this building! It houses two branches of Hilton hotels, a MAC health club, a movie theater and a parking garage. Get to breakfast early - it is a mad house in the last 1/2 hour. Good points - Brand new hotel. Full kitchen, free breakfast, free wireless internet, access to health club pool, laundry facility available. Nice, helpful staff - shout out to Russel and Courtney at the front desk, and Antonio in maintenance. Bad points - Small room was crammed with furniture. Yeah, the pictures of the suites are impressive, but we couldn't get a suite. There was hardly room to walk between the counter bar stools, chairs, large desk/TV stand and king bed. "Harbor East" is not "Inner Harbor" $22 a day for parking! Annoying "satin" cover on the duvet practically guaranteed that it slipped off the bed every five minutes - whose idea was that? I think there were only 20 cable channels to choose from, and 4 of them were ESPN. Do we really need FOUR ESPN channels?

Reviews.Title: “What pool?”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeSomeWhere1
Reviews.Content: The bad: ---------------------- 1. Pool The pool doesn't belong to the hotel. It belongs to the health club in the same building. As a hotel guest, you do not get to use the pool as pictured. The hotel guests are all crammed into one small pool area. We got to use the pool for 15 minutes on Saturday. There are two other pools we could not use. One was empty and the other had one man doing laps the 15 minutes we were there. We visited Bmore for a long weekend and the pool closed by 5 or 6 each day. It was not open on Easter. On Saturday the life guard decided to close early and forced everyone out about 20 minutes early. 2. Bar noise Our room faced the James Joyce Bar and on Friday night we got to listen to what sounded like live, very loud music from the outdoor patio until very late at night. Fortunately we brought a small hepa air cleaner and that drowned out enough music to allow our children to sleep. 3. I think they want you to bring your own towels. They are STINGY with towels. We are a family of four. We had three towels the day we checked in and made do the first night and next morning. When the cleaning staff came in they left us with only 1 towel and hand towel. We got back to our hotel fairly late and had to call room service to get towels. When they showed up they tried to give us only two. What? 4. Linens Our children slept on a pull out sleeper couch and linens had been left on from the previous visit. They were dirty and full of food crumbs. We had no other linens in the room other than heavy blankets. 5. Parking is expensive You have to park in a PMI parking lot that is very expensive. It cost us $40 to park in the lot Fri - Sun. 6. Breakfast The breakfast is free and is a lot like what other restaurants offer but they could not keep anything stocked. Both mornings that we ate there they were out of forks, bowls, cereals and much of the food for long periods of time. Depending upon which elevator you go down on, you end up at one of two eating places. The nicer side costs $10 or so and has pretty much the same food as the free side. It has omelets made to order and had some fruit. It was less crowded and apparently didn't run out of stuff as much. I never saw a sign indicating the one side wasn't free. The Good --------------------------- 1. Location The location was great and we never moved our car. 2. Rooms The decor is updated and the rooms were comfortable. 3. Staff They were always friendly and pleasant. Actually they stood out above any hotel staff I can think of in the last 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cherryblossomtravels
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in this hotel. First, the front desk sent us up twice to a room that was not ready and did little to help accomodate us in the meantime. Second, we had chosen this hotel primarily because of positive reviews of the swimming pool, and my kids were so excited to go swimming. The pool was great -- but it was closed for two of the three days we were there, which was a BIG disappointment to the kids and us. Again, the front desk had no alternatives to accomodate us when the pool, which actually belongs to an adjoining health club, was closed. On the plus side, the location was excellent for visiting the inner harbor, aquarium, and children's museum and there were nice restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and included breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pjz201
Reviews.Content: Location is less than 5 minute walk to Inner Harbor, view- non exsistant, the Marriot waterfront is blocking the hotel, clean room, nice to have a little kitchen in the room for leftovers, microwave, sink, silverware, and dishes. Bathroom was clean and a hairdryer was hiding in the closet. The bed was very comfortable, and tv could be viewed from bed or couch, nice touch. The breakfast was fine, your not moving in permanantly, good for a few days, cereals, hot foods,. bread, etc, lots of choices for kids and adults. Coffee was ok, not bad, and they had to go cups that helped get the day started. Parking is behind the hotel, paid about $45 dollars for 2 full days, 3 nights, safe, maybe alittle expensive, but it was freezing at 12am in March, so I dealt with it. Lots of other choices around the area if you have some time to drive around. Also there was a Starbucks to the left of the hotel lobby, and a seafood rest. a block down, looked busy, we didn't go. Easy walk to lots of popular rest. from the hotel, Ruth Chris, ESPN Zone, Fogo de Chao(maybe 10 mins) I would definately stay here again, good price and laid back atmosphere for a quick weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful port in a storm!”
Reviews.Author: buck_in_baltimore
Reviews.Content: In between the two giant snowstorms that hit the mid-Atlantic region in February of 2010, we lost power at our house in a suburb of Baltimore. Knowing a huge snow was coming and with no assurances from the power company about when we'd have electricity again, I quickly booked two nights at the Homewood Suites in Baltimore, in the up and coming Harbor East neighborhood. We got my family (me, wife, daughters 12 and 9) checked into a 1-bedroom suite just as the storm hit. From the first moment we arrived the staff was excellent and helpful. They even waived the usual $100 pet fee for us, as we had to bring our two pet gerbils with us so they wouldn't freeze at home. The hotel is beautiful and clean, and our 1 bedroom suite allowed the kids to have a room and TV of their own. The first night as the blizzard hit we walked just across the street to the James Joyce Irish pub for a great dinner. This hotel also is attached to a state of the art health club, and guests of the hotel can use it for free. The next morning my wife and I worked out and then went swimming with the kids, in a heated pool on the second floor with floor to ceiling windows that afforded an incredible view of the snowstorm outside! Even the staff that hosts the free continental breakfast and free homestyle-simple dinners were really friendly. Also next door is a multi-screen theater with tiered seating. We hoped to take in a movie the first full afternoon, but when Kenyatta at the front desk of the hotel checked for us, she found the snow had closed it. Upon hearing that, she disappeared into the back and returned with an envelope good for a free in-room movie and two boxes of movie candy for us! We had a movie night anyway! We had to extend another night as well as get a late checkout on our last day (all with a "no problem!" from the desk staff), and among the things we did during our stay was walk around the corner to the drug store to get a medication extension for my wife (who had forgotten to pack that in our haste to leave home), visit the Starbucks next door, shop for furniture on the same block, walk to the Inner Harbor ESPN Zone to play games and eat dinner one night, and within the hotel itself, there was a small library where my wife found a book to read, and we enjoyed a free pool table. We almost hated to go home after three nights. It was not cheap, but was worth every penny to us, and we call it our impromptu snowstorm vacation! We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a well-kept, courteously staffed, and convenient hotel in which to spend some time in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: Taxbert
Reviews.Content: I will always stay here when in Baltimore. New building. Safe area. Convenient to inner harbor and Fells Point. Free breakfast all week and dinner Mon-Thur. There is a full fitness center in the same building and guests get free (yes free) use of the fitness center. The fitness center has a 25 yard pool, racket ball courts and many weight and exercise machines. I was with a group of colleagues from work and they were staying at a hotel by the Federal Building. They complained that their hotel was noisy and there were homeless around at night. Several of them switched to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just about the nicest hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: j1954
Reviews.Content: This is just about the best thought out hotel I have stayed in. Nice location, spotless, great staff & nice size rooms. Little things like a TV that swivels between living area & bed so you can watch it from anywhere. Well insulated because when you are in the room, you hear nothing. Nice to go to the bar for a drink. Billiards room, Library, Huge fitness center, beautiful lobby, it just doesn't end. Cannot find a single negative about it & would think it was a bargain at twice the price, which alot of surrounding hotels are. Be sure to visit the James Joyce Restaurant across the street

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: morrisn
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at this hotel with another couple (seperate rooms) for their aniversary. This hotel is within 2 blocks of the water, next to Little Italy, and within walking distance of the Aquarium. Breakfast was included with the stay. The hotel was affordable, clean, and convenient. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectation. A comfort.”
Reviews.Author: CaptAdventure
Reviews.Content: I will always feel gratitude for this hotel. A relative was at Johns Hopkins Hospital for two weeks for two difficult surgeries and major recovery. The hotel provided 2 cab vouchers to the hospital/day and a warm breakfast and dinner four days a week. The rooms were spotless and comfortable (minus the sofa bed, but I forgive them for that completely). There were multiple warm fireplaces and comfortable nooks throughout the building. Staff was friendly and kind. There were posters advertising free access to a gym, had I wanted to use it. The hotel is in a prime location and cabs are always available in the front. It's a short walk to good restaurants and better yet, a Whole Foods and a CVS. The wireless was free and easy to access. The price for our suite was so unbelievable I'm afraid to mention it. Anyone needing to stay in Baltimore to be near family at JHH should absolutely call this hotel and ask for the rate they offer for Hopkins-related stays. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “clean big no frills or service, on your own”
Reviews.Author: will_cheeba
Reviews.Content: Big suites, Very clean and new. however you are on your own. Bath Fan ran all night, no parking no valet no help. Parking behind hotel is a walk and cost 22 per day they do not validate. The breakfast is like a hot mess barely classified as breakfast. Marriot waterfront is a better choice free parking and more people to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMamaMd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites on October 31st, for one night, just a retreat. I called the hotel at about 1pm to inquire about an early check-in and was told I could check in now. When I arrived at 1:30, I was assisted by Krystal (very nice young lady), who informed me a suite was ready for me & tod me everything the hotel offered its guests. Unlike many of the other reviews, it was easy for me determine which hotel was which as there were signs posted. After checking in, I took the elevator up to my suite and was impressed. It was very clean. Everything was in great condition. It was quiet and relaxing, no noise from the suite above or next to me. I think the have great insulaltion & soundproofing, which you don't get in other hotels. I didn't mind the limited cable channels as I spent time reading or on the net. The high speed connection was good. The MAC was great, free access for hotel guests. The next morning I went down to see what was on the menu for breakfast. It was pretty much what the other reviews stated: sausage, bacon, omelets, scambled eggs, waffles, potatoes, hot/cold cereal, fruit, danishes, yogurt, coffee & juice. They did express check-out, so there's no need to wait in line as I didn't accrue any charges. Despite some of the other reviews, I didn't have any trouble with my HH certificate. I was treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: CNONewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a family with small children. The studio suite was perfect for a family of four. The room had plenty of light, nice kitchenette, king size bed with a pull out couch. Loved the flat screen that would easily turn to face the living area or the king size bed. The rooms were very clean. The hotel also provided free wireless and use of gym and indoor pool, as well as, free continental breakfast and afternoon snack on weekday. The location was perfect. We walked with stroller in tow to all the sites and museums in Inner Harbor, including the Children's Museum. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, furnishings and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: marspin
Reviews.Content: My husband and took our 3 kids ages 9 and 3 to the inner harbor the last weekend in August. This hotel was a great deal. We paid $199/night for a 2 room suite. One room had two double beds and the other a small kitchen/living room. Our only complaint is that the only TV channels for the kids were PBS (at night shows are for adults) and Cartoon Network. NO DVD or VCR in the room. All the kids shows like Disney Channel, NICK, etc had to be rented which I thought was a rip-off at $5.99 to see an episode of Arthur or Dora. Bring a portable DVD player if your kids watch a movie before bed or naptime. The room was recently renovated and was very up to date and clean. Hallways and lobby of hotel were modern and clean as well. Included in the cost of the room was breakfast for everyone. Both days hot breakfast was served...pancakes, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, yogurt, eggs, bagel, etc. Also included, was a light dinner served between 5-7pm in the same room as breakfast. We didn't realize this was available until the 2nd night. We were pleasantly surprised that stuffed shells, green beans, salad, drinks & WINE were served as well as cookies. There was a dinner menu posted on the fridge in our room so we thought we would give it a try and it was great..especially since it was free for a family of five. The location is great. It is in walking distance to aquarium, science center, Little Italy and inner harbor. We even walked to Camden Yards one night to see a Yankee game. Also, not bell hops so you have to take your luggage up and down from your room which wasn't a big deal since they had luggage carts. Overall it was definately a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location though limited view”
Reviews.Author: SoundviewWest
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family (2 rooms) here quite recently and loved the location. It's easy walking distance to the Inner Harbor (the ads say it's on the harbor but not true, there is a hotel between this location and the water) and rooms were clean, comfortable and service was friendly and helpful. The front desk is a bit confusing as you check in on one side of the lobby while the other is another Hilton hotel so be sure to stay to the left! Parking is quite convenient and accessible through an elevator in the lobby so in case of poor weather you can get to/from your vehicle without event. The breakfast room (included in price) is above average though the room in which it's served is hardly cozy...a very large room with a television about a mile away at the other end from where we were seated. But, food selection was very good, egg dishes and bacon etc. for hot choices. Overall, this is a place we liked and would stay again with little thought to the plethora of other choices in the area. Price? Probably OK for the area due to location.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: shademann
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at this hotel. I bring my son (Who is now 10)here ever time this year. Baltimore school system starts the first week of September so all the local attractions are empty. No lines no crowds. Complimentary access to the health club that is sharing the building is nice. Location can not be beat. Walking distance to Science Center, Aquarium and ships. Zoo is about 30 min. This is a the real selling point to this hotel Esp. when parking is very expensive in this area. Staff is friendly and accommodating. The room is clean & comes with a full kitchenette. They have upgraded to flat screen TV's. Beds are soft and comfortable. Excellent sound proofing between suites. The Furniture and carpet are showing their age. A wear/ stain here and there. Not bad but but four star caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Good as last time”
Reviews.Author: PugFish
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice size rooms. But room are dirty and carpets stained. Health club on premises. Not much staff around. Small lobby. Near Little Italy. Good rates. My wife will not go back because the rooms are getting garbaged out. Probably the red Sox fans.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Overall Experience In The Finest Tradition of Homewood”
Reviews.Author: MorganFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently on a quick recreational visit with my 20 year old daughter. The hotel is set in an excellent location, and is very clean and well-appointed. The rooms are fairly spacious, and the large flat scren is a very nice touch. The kitchen is well arranged and fully functional, and the lounge was, as is the case with most Homewoods, a great addition to the value of this stay. I had only two minor issues. First, when I arrived, I was told to park in the wrong garage and, as a consequence, I got doublecharged for parking. The manager of the hotel, however, was VERY accomodating and, without any hassle whatsoever, adjusted the bill (even though I was staying there on points). Second, at about 10 before 9 one evening, I went down to the bar. Apparently, 9:00 is last call and the barmaid (natasha) really seemed put out that someone was arriving that "late" and wanted to actually have a drink. She made it abundantly clear that she had someplace to go and equally clear that she didn't really appreciate having to hold off on clean up because I had arrived. While that was unpleasant, it didn't do anything to diminish what was otherwise a great stay, and I would very much recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the Inner Harbor area. P.S. -- They recommended Mo's Seafood Restaurant and, in a waord, it was AWESOME!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but beware of parking”
Reviews.Author: jmsrb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from a Monday to Tuesday with a friend and her two daughters. We were going to visit the Baltimore National Aquarium and the Children's Discovery Museum. The location of the hotel was great. It was about a ten minute walk (at a pace comfortable for a 5-year old) to the Aquarium and a four block walk to the Children's Museum. There were also several restaurants within walking distance (less than 3/4 of a mile) of the hotel. We liked Mo's Crab and Pasta Factory, which I'll review as well. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The only problem we had with the hotel was parking. We pulled into the parking garage of the hotel (though not managed by the hotel) at 11am on Monday and left around 1pm the following Tuesday. We thought our charge would be $25, as this is what the Hilton website states and I had confirmed beforehand we would not be charged extra for arriving prior to check-in time. However, our parking charge was $36. We were quite confused as we checked with the front desk prior to checking out to make sure we didn't need to get our parking ticket validated. They said "no" and that the charge would be $22. We paid the $36 and I called to attempt to resolve the situation. I was told the Hilton website parking charge is incorrect and now I have to jump through hoops to try to resolve the matter, as the garage is managed by an outside company.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel From Hell in Baltimore - The Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuyMd_Pa_Nj
Reviews.Content: The experience was horrible, and I have documented the "high" points here: http://hotelfromhellbaltimore.blogspot.com/ Just as a postnote, our trip took us into Pennsylvania, where we stayed at a Best Western. It has been terrific. I genuinely believe that the Hilton chain may be at fault, too old, not able to provide all that newer hotels have. The stay in Homewood Suites was unbelievably bad. Check out the blog, particularly the details of the room's problems, the post about Armageddon: http://hotelfromhellbaltimore.blogspot.com/2009/08/homewood-suite-baltimore-armageddon.html

Reviews.Title: “Red Sox Get Away”
Reviews.Author: dlobmwm3
Reviews.Content: We traveled here to let our 4 yr old son see his first MLB Red Sox game. The rooms were very clean and well planned out. Great location to some restaurants and a movie theatre right next door. I gave it 4 stars due to a few things: Parking was not free in the parking deck ($22/day), only children's TV channel was Cartoon network and no Disney or Noggin channel, parking deck is not easily accessible when checking in/checking out (elevator only and no stairs), when we check in the staff did not inform us of the free breakfast and only found out on the last day when we overheard other folks talking. Other than these few things, the hotel was very clean. Attractions are about a 1 mile away including the ballpark.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Tries hard but not quite up to snuff...”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler014
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our entire family last year (2008) to see Red Sox play Baltimore Orioles. Had a beautiful room with a view of the harbor (since mainly blocked by new construction hotel). Thought, oh, why not this year but instead of a suite with a double room, got a suite with king. Maybe a mistake? Good things: Check-in quick and efficient, parking (although expensive $25.00 in/out privileges, 22 no in/out privileges, at least it is close and you have a choice of services!) People working desk/guest service are caring and efficient. So I got the extra bar of soap I asked for and the coffee beyond regular quickly--one bar of soap left for 3 people to use for bath and hand washing. . People working desk very helpful as I added/took out things for safe deposit behind desk. Close to Inner Harbor attractions. James Joyce Pub across street (very nice!), not far from Flemings Steak House/Wine bar. Whole Foods around corner, CVS 24 hours around corner. MAC (Maryland Athletic Club) fabulous facility free of charge and highly available to guests of this hotel and others in the area. Great WIFi connection throughout the hotel. Attractive lobby. Good included breakfast including hot menu items such as pancakes, scrambled eggs, pastries, etc. Not so great things: Dirty mattress pad left ON sleep sofa bed, I'm talking blood stains (fresh blood, not washed and stained), semen stains (I'm assuming), and some black dots that we were hoping were not bed bugs! Then daughter and I talking on bed while husband brought the suitcases to car in garage. I felt something funny crawling under me, it was a baby COCKROACH! I live in southern VA so although I don't have them in my house, am well aware of what a cockroach is. Could be a problem in the inner city of Baltimore such as they have in NY? I'm not sure. Two bath towels left for 3 people on Saturday for Sunday--Called for towels at 8:30 a.m. got towels at 9:33 breakfast ended at 10:00 wasn't helpful for daughter who wanted to eat breakfast, therefore she dried off with two HAND towels. Sleep sofa covered with stains on upholstery as well as above mattress cover issues, not very attractive/tempting for poor daughter who had to sleep on it! This facility definitely needs some upgrading to take care of these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: BoaterPortLudlow
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel close to the Inner Harbor East Marina where my sister lives aboard her boat. I chose the Homewood Suites since it had the best price and was not disappointed. The room, on the 10th floor, had wonderful views, a full kitchen, living room, bedroom and large bath and dressing area. I couldn't have been more pleased with the service and modern design. The parking at $25 a day for in/out privileges was a bit confusing at first and could have been better explained by the hotel staff upon check in. After I figured it out with the help of a hotel employee, it was easy, safe and secure! Excellent restaurants including those in Little Italy and Baltimore's terrific inner harbor are all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, Very Convenient, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: RSW777
Reviews.Content: Two-night stay with our three young children. We would have preferred a one-bedroom suite over the studio, but the Red Sox were in town to play the Orioles and the hotel was full. The room was modern and very comfortable. The location is terrific, only a few minutes walk from the aquarium/inner harbor, as well as Little Italy's restaurants (very close). Breakfast was impressive and well-staffed. The hotel adjoins not only a Hilton Garden Inn, but a massive fitness club to which guests have full access (we used the kids-size pool, part of a large aquatics area). There's also a quiet "library" area, and a billiards table (quite unusual). Service was friendly and attentive. Parking is in an adjoining garage, and ran us about $45 total for the two nights. We used Hilton Honors points, but any price under $200 is worth it given everything the hotel offers. There's a Whole Foods a block away, a Starbucks adjoing the lobby, and various upscale bars, shops, and restaurants in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but with some setbacks”
Reviews.Author: BelleVirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 3 young kids (ages 7,4 and 1). While the room was ready early for check in it was apparently turned over too quickly by housekeeping. We had a few set backs: an old razor and bars of soap left in the shower, a bottom sheet and comforter but no top sheet or blanket on one bed, and latex gloves (presumably left by housekeeping) in a drawer in the living room. While housekeeping did come up right away to clean the shower again, when I went to turn the beds down for the night (around 8pm) I noticed the sheet problem. When I called down to the desk I was told housekeeping was on break and wouldn't be able to come up for 45 min. This was unacceptable as I had 3 very tired kids that needed sleep fast. So my husband went down and got sheets and we made the bed ourselves. He also took the gloves down with him when he went to get sheets as my one year old had found the gloves and was playing with them. When he complained to the manager he was told they couldn't comp our stay b/c of the rate we booked but would send him a certificate for a free night. We are HH's members. So they did try to do something at least. The furniture in the living room was a bit worn, stains and such all over the couch. Some minor stains on the floor. The fan was nice in the room as it was a bit warmer in there. There was an on/off switch for our fan and it did work. The beds were comfortable. The shower and tub were clean and free of mold which was a very big plus for me. Another big plus was the workout center and the pool. While we didn't use the workout center, we walked through it for the pool and it was one of the nicest I have ever seen. They had 3 pools: one workout pool, one lap pool and a smaller pool for the kids. Also a hot tub. We used the smaller pool and there were noodles and kick boards for the kids. Also, the lifeguard was so nice and got my one year old a life jacket and a toy rubber duck to play with. The water was heated too so it was very comfortable to swim in. They are all indoor pools by the way. It was a big hit with the kids. We walked to a baseball game at Camden Yards the first day and while it was doable I wouldn't recommend it for little kids. We had the one year old in a stroller so that was ok, but our others (7 yo and 4 yo) were tired and not really wanting to keep walking. It's a good 20 min to Camden Yards from the hotel. Walking to the Inner Harbor and the Aquarium however was very easy, even for the kids. We had breakfast one morning and it was good, didn't eat the hot food, but they had plenty of cereals, yogurts and milk etc. Overall, it was a good stay. Like I said, some minor setbacks with housekeeping upon checking in, though I really just think it was the room being turned over too fast and not double checked. A little far to Camden Yards but very close to the Inner Harbor and the Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AshHatMac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Homewood Suites during a corporate event in Baltimore. We really enjoyed our stay in the hotel. Our room was very clean, but for a new hotel, the living room furniture and comforter seemed worn. Also, the fan in the bathroom runs constantly (no off switch) so we had to cover it with a piece of paper to soften the noise. The bed was very comfortable though and the shower stayed hot and had good pressure. We were on the top floor and had an excellent view of the statue in the round-a-bout below and of the harbor. The room was plenty big enough and the TV is very large. We only stayed one night, but it would have been comfortable for a longer stay. Breakfast was good, they had a fairly wide selection of hot and cold choices and everything we had tasted good. The hotel's location is great, we were within walking distance to Pier 5 that had a lot of great attractions, bars, and restaurants and access to the water taxi and aquarium. Service was great, everyone was very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “never been served more competently”
Reviews.Author: sasso2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are not from Baltimore but travelled here for surgery at Johns Hopkins for him. I have been to lovely 5 star hotels all around the world, but I have never been served so well as we have been here. There is a special Johns Hopkins rate here, there is free round trip taxi ride to the hospital each day. Breakfast is included. The most perfect example is that on the day before my husband was released from the hospital, we asked the people at the front desk to find a place where we could rent a recliner. They found the place and had it delivered to our room that very day. Unbelieveably helpful, competent, and willing to serve. I recommend this place without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “terrific experience, great value”
Reviews.Author: fam5ily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend with our 3 young children in a one bedroom suite. King size bed in the bedroom and double queen size pull out in the sitting area accomodated us nicely (with a child sleeping in the big bed with us). You could put a cot in the bedroom but it would be tight. We put all 3 kids to sleep in the king bed and then had the sitting area to hang out (with the door between closed), then transferred 2 kids to the sleeper when adults were ready for bed. Small utility kitchen was well stocked with silverware, plates,etc.. Grocery store and large drugstore just down the block so easy to stock some basics without getting in the car. Breakfast buffet was good, not great but very convenient and we found it to be well kept. Service was very good and friendly from check in to check out without rudeness or problems I had read about in other reviews. Location is great - a few blocks from the aquarium, inner harbor, little italy. Easy walking distance although you might want a stroller for small children. Parking is expensive but conveniently attached to the back of the hotel. We had a great experience here, one of our better family hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hallmart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend with our 4 children ages 2-9. The room worked out very nicely - especially for the price. The location is excellent. It's a walk to some of the attractions but we walked all the way to Camden Yards and back with our children. Very do able. Water taxi is very convenient and fun. Breakfast is acceptable - not great but it worked. Our only negative comment is about the pool. The pool is within the health club, not always available and there can only be 2 children per adult. Our whole idea was to bring the 3 older kids while 1 napped...no can do.

Reviews.Title: “Just sit back and relax, Everything is so close if you decide to leave the room.”
Reviews.Author: Chancealot
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our stay at the Homewood Suites. The room was clean and spacious. There's a Whole Foods Market so close by if you want a healthy meal or yummy treat. The staff was very kind helpful and certainly professional. Parking was a little odd- just make sure you unload your luggage at the front when you check in because you will have to park around back and take an elevator to the lobby. You may even want to take your luggage up to your room. All in all the room was so comfortable that we spent a lot of time just relaxing. The complimentary light dinner (during the week) and breakfast was a pleasant surprise. We will certainly go back to Homewood Suites on our next trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: preciousschoolgirl
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors V.I.P. and a faithful guest. I have been staying in Baltimore while out of school for summer break. I arrived at Hilton Garden on Thursday May 7, 2009. I thought that this location was beautiful and that I would truly enjoy my stay. However since here, I have been treated very rudely! I will only mention the incidents that have really truly upset me. I must advise that I checked out for the first time since May 7 on May14 because of the rudeness from Donna the manager at the front desk, but the location I moved to was not what I was looking for. I wanted to be close to the water and I flew in, so I needed to be somewhere where everything was in walking distance, which the Homewood Inner Harbor location suited me perfectly. Sometimes I want a good home cooked meal while away from home, and here I can cook, and everything is very convenient. Well, I checked back in on Friday the 15th paying 195.00 covering me until Saturday morning. Saturday morning I enquired about the rate, and it was 139.00 plus tax, so I paid 300.00 to cover me until Monday the 18th. Sunday night I received a call from Donna the manager saying I needed to come down and pay. I explained to her that I already paid. She said, "no you need to come down and pay, or else I will have to have security come down and escort you out of your room. I then (with a little extra bass in my voice) said that I have already paid, and you are dead wrong, and I will need an apology tomorrow, and I will be contacting the manager! She then said " I guess we'll just have to send you some more free stuff!!! I was completely floored! I then decided that these calls needed to be recorded just in case they did put me out 6 hours away from home in a room that I had paid for, than that was completely grounds for a law suit! I then called back and Skylar answered the phone. I tried to explain to her that they were wrong in a very calm manner She would not agree even after I completely explained how, when, and who I paid! They also disconnected my phone not allowing me to call out. This a.m. when I woke, I went downstairs and requested the manager contact me because I was still very upset, even now writing this, I am fuming! I called and called for the manager, My call finally reaching him at 2 p.m. He told me he would speak to Scott TOMORROW! Are you kidding me???? And also, for me to lay down and get some rest or go out and get some fresh air! Really, what is that supposed to do?!. I called back down when 2nd shift got here actually trying to give one of these ladies a chance to apologize. Skylar answered,. and I said " So, you guys were wrong!" She did not apologize, but did admit that I was caught up on my room last night while being harassed at 10:15 p.m. I do have taped phone calls on my cell phone. My mother taught me very well! I document and record everything. I then asked for corporate number, she said 1-800-HILTON. After calling that number and seeing that was not enough numbers, I then called back up front and Donna answered. I then told het that I would never need anything for free, I have paid more e money in my room than what she makes in a month and I will never need anything for free, after all my house isn’t sitting in a puddle! I said this because no manager has taken care of this issue, and they have been able to say what they want to me, no manager has stepped in, so obviously I need to step up and say something! I was almost in tears last night- tears of anger, humiliation, and I am still extremely upset! I have spoke to Katrina from corporate and she was in disbelief, she gave me several apologies, which I can't say for the hotel. She has promised that both ladies will formally apologize to me this week, and I can't wait! Karma is something! I will write my reviews and pass this on to whoever until this issue gets solved! Corporate has promised satisfaction in 3 days, no more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at Homewood Suites Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: DeeCSW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a HH reward for one night to see a Yankees-Orioles game. We normally stay at the Hampton Inn Camden Yards when going to games but wanted to try something new. The location of the hotel is very convenient to the Inner Harbor and about a 15-20 minute walk to the stadium. The neighborhood around the hotel is great, with a Starbucks next door, Haagen Dazs, movie theatre, and a Whole Foods around the block. I liked the convenience of the hotel parking garage ($22 overnight, $25 with in/out priveleges), as there was an elevator that took us staright from the lot to the lobby. The only negative during our stay was at check-in. The woman at the desk reacted less than enthusiastically when I presented her with my paperwork for my Hilton Honors stay. I don't know if was because it was "free" (as she announced rather loudly, with a hint of sarcasm for all the world to hear, or at least the people standing behind us). This kind of amused me as a Hilton Honors member staying in a Hilton-owned hotel, I would expect at the very least, a smile. Oh well. Maybe next time? I was given keys but not told any other information, such as when and where breakfast would be served, where the gym was located, where the pool was located and its hours, etc. We were given Room 559, a Studio Suite, despite my preference for a higher floor away from elevators and ice machines (my standard preference that automatically kicks up on my rewards reservations). Fortunately, we did not experience any noise from either despite their close proximity to the room. The suite itself was lovely; there is a cute little kitchenette and we were treated to a free bag of microwave popcorn and 2 bottles of water in the fridge. We did not cook during our stay so I cannot comment on the kitchen being well stocked. The room was large and more than adequate for the three of us (2 adults, and and one child). Our son slept on the pull-out sofabed (had to call the front desk for sheets) and we took the king-sized bed. Loved the swivel tv. Our little guy went to sleep, and we liked being able to turn the tv around without the glare/sound bothering him at all. The bathroom vanity/sink was outside, and as others have noted, and this can be bothersome to whomever is in the bed, especially late at night if you have to turn the light on (it's bright!!). Shower was a nice size. Breakfast is served on the 2nd floor and there was a nice selection of hot food. We kind of overdid it with the eggs, bacon and sausage. There were also pancakes and cold cereals. Plenty of juice and coffee, etc. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay. We will definitely consider returning next year for our annual Yankees weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, love the quiche!”
Reviews.Author: Kasino-Kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights for vacation. This hotel is located within easy walking distance to Little Italy and the Inner Harbor. The rates were very reasonable and included a hot buffet breakfast. Our studio was spacious and had a great flat screen that swiveled from the living area to the bedroom area. Peekaboo view of the water, too. Nice having a kitchen with a fridge and microwave. Breakfast is excellent, except there were some large groups staying and the kids were pretty aggressive with grabbng food. They were pretty good about restocking, though. Our last morning there was a phenomenal cheddar-bacon quiche. I asked the manager for the recipe; he got the chef to write it down for me! We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: rosimmom
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located one and half blocks from the aquarium. It was roomy and really clean. We booked a aaa rate and saved money. The breakfast was good. The kids loved that we had a seperate bed room and living room area. The bathroom was spacious. The pool was great. This is a great value for families. Our kitchen clean and had all the dishes and stuff we needed. We needed extra towels and within ten minutes of our call housekeeping was there. This was at nine at night. The only complaint we had was that you had to watch which dishes you used at the breakfast as they were not all so clean( really a minor thing). But we loved this hotel and recommend it to everyone especially families. Be advised the parking is $22 per day and $25 for in and out parking. But this is on par with the other hotels in the area as it is in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice for fun and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: danfriedmanlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of its high rating on this website (please note this hotel was built in 2007 with the Hilton Garden Inn and they are all one building with a common lobby. This review is for the Homewood suties). The reviewers were not wrong. Best bang for your buck in the inner harbor. The hotel is located in a new area of the inner harbor called Harbor East. The Marriot is between you and the water but there were still water views from our 10th floor room. The hotel was at least 1/2 the cost of the marriot in front of us with a lot more amenities. We had a one room suite with a big sitting area and pullout couch for my daughter, a full kitchen, and a king sized bed for 3 nights for $415 (the weekday stay was 1 1/2 times the cost of the weekend nights probably because the area is designed for weekday business people. By the way parking is extra at about 25 a day). There was a 42 inch tv that pivoted so you could watch it from the bed or the living room. There was a free hot breakfast everyday, on weekdays they have a free evening appetizer meal (for example stuffed shells, salad, vegetable and cookies) each afternoon from 5-7 with beer and wine. They are attached to a full sized gym that is brand new and completely state of the art with free membership for all hotel guests that has a large lap pool for adults, a larger pool for water aerobics and a medium pool for families with kids filled with noodles and kick boards and water wings and a lifeguard as well as full gym facilities, big changing rooms with showers and lockers, squash rooms, spin classes etc. The hotel staff went above and beyond to help us out and the area is so brand new so there are plenty of restaurants, starbucks, whole foods, haagan daaz, and a great movie theatre right next door. it was a 15 minute walk to the fells point bars and restaurants, 15 minutes to the inner harbor and it was 5 minutes to little italy. There was a water taxi stop in front of the marriot so that was 2 min. away. All in all this was a great vacation. Our only issue was a recommendation by one of the managers for a restaurant called "the greasy spoon". We were told that it was in walking distance and we never found it. We checked the next day and she repeated the directions and said she saw it there that morning. We drove past the area and beyond, twice. we never found it. I also did an internet search and it never came up. I don't know what the deal was but we never found anything like what she told us about. We did love Blue Moon Cafe, Miss Shirley's, Dangerously Delicious Pies and a new gelato place two doors down from Bertha's mussles in fells point.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NyNiftyfifty
Reviews.Content: I was there march 13th to the 15th with my senior citizens parents for a wedding. We got two rooms located next to each other. This place was great. The rooms were immaculate. The rooms are all suites, you have your Kitchenette with microwave, refirg, two top burners, and diswasher. They supply you with plates, silverware and glasses. There is a flat screen T.V. that is located on top of a long desk that is located in the middle of the room where you can revolve the T.V to the living room for viewing or revolve to the side of the bedroom for viewing. The Beds are very comfortable. The location of this hotel you cannot i repeat cannot BEAT!!!!. you can walk across the street and there is the harbor, a very short walk, my 76 year old mother and i took a morning walk over there and she was quite good with it... There are plenty of restaurants around.to visit you can even order from an outside restaurant and they will deliver to your room....what service...I do have one "However"...If you are parking your car in their garage and you are staying more than a day...make sure you tell the person at check in that you require a long term parking ticket...this will allow you to enter and exit the garage as many times as you want during the day or night...the charge is $25.00 a day..otherwise you will be paying as you enter and exit. So, do yourself a favor, the next time you come to Baltimore stay at the Homewood Suites you will not be disappointed. a great value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good price, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: where2nextPA
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in a studio suite with king bed last weekend. Overall our experience was very good and we wished we were staying another night. The room was very nice - and very clean. The kitchen was updated, clean, and had everything you would need if you wanted to cook, a big fridge, plus a kitchen bar with 2 seats. The big screened tv rotated, so you could lay in bed and watch, or turn it around to face the living room area. The bed was very comfortable, although I didn't care for the light fluffy pillows (I personally prefer a more weighted, heavier pillow). The only thing about the layout of the room I didn't like was the bathroom/vanity area. The bathroom had the shower and toilet in it, but the sink/mirror is outside the bathroom in the vanity area. While I was getting ready in the morning, at the vanity area, I had to turn the lights on, which are very bright and woke my 20 month old and husband. There is no door separating the vanity area from the bedroom area. I personally like to have privacy when getting ready and would prefer for there to be a door there ( at least just for keeping the bright lights from others sleeping still). That was really the only thing I didn't like. I loved the complementary hot breakfast in the morning. We ate so much, we actually skipped lunch that day. They had everything you could want - eggs, bacon, sausage, some kind of grits, potatoes, oatmeal, cereal, milk, coffee, fruit, yogurt, tea, juice, bagels, toast, muffins... We got down there early and it wasn't busy at all. They even brought out a high chair for our little one. After breakfast, we headed to the aquarium ( about 5-10 min. walk). We requested a late checkout and they said we could check out at 1:00. (12:00 is the usual checkout time). You are allowed to keep your car in the lot until 4:00 pm without getting charged additional $ too, which is nice if you want extra time to do whatever you want, without having to worry about moving your car. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will prob. stay here again next time we are in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: rchs20
Reviews.Content: In our stay last summer, we arrived early in Baltimore and decided to try to check in at the hotel. The woman at the front desk was pleasant and said to come back at 1:00pm. We then asked her to make sure that two cribs or pack and plays would be available since we have 1 year old twins. She said not a problem and she would mark it on our reservation and call housekeeping to confirm. With this, my family embarked on our way to the Inner Harbor. When we returned at 1:45pm to check in, there was a different gentleman at the desk, we checked in and asked about the cribs. He was also pleasant and professional and stated that he did not see them on the reservation, but he would call housekeeping to make sure that our request would be filled. A little annoyed but assured, we went up to the room so that our twins could take their afternoon nap. They slept on the floor, but my wife made sure and slept right beside them for safety. They had just begun to walk, so we did not want them wandering in the dark if they woke up early. After nap, we decided to leave for dinner. We decided to check one more time to make sure that the cribs would be in the room when we returned so that the twins could go to bed. Another woman was at the front desk. This time she stated that there were no available cribs in the entire hotel. There was no apology, no empathy, not even an "I'm sorry". My wife then inquired and told of the promises from the earlier employees to the same robotic response. If not for this, the hotel was very nice. Good breakfast in the morning. Great location. Great price. I am not sure if I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money!”
Reviews.Author: borobabe_69
Reviews.Content: First impressions count and I was not disappointed. On arrival I realised the location of the hotel was perfect for our needs. The hotel building was very nice and the reception area very smart and clean. We approached the reception staff who immediately came to our aid and were most efficient and friendly. The male receptionist was fantastic, he asked if we had any preferences as to where our room was and realising we had a teenage daughter with us he immediately upgraded us to a one-bedroomed suite which had amazing views on two sides with huge panoramic windows. There was bags of space and a wonderfully comfy bed! Everything possible had been provided for our needs including free coffee etc but what surprised us the most was that there was even free dinner in the restaurant! So a big up to the hotel and it's staff who were all very helpful and sooo friendly. I will definitely stay here again as I often visit this area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: Psyman42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a night and it was amazing. We stayed in the one bedroom suite with kitchen, everything was clean and perfect. The complimentary gym pass to the health club in the building was great, included a full gym and swimming pool. Definately would try to stay at any of these hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parkie1
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel shares a building with a Hilton Garden Inn. Located about a block from the Inner Harbor, it is within walking distance of Fells Point (5 minutes to the east), Little Italy (2 minutes to the north), and the Convention Center (15 minutes to the north). The upscale neighborhood is a developing mix of condos, hotels, movie theaters (right next door), museums, small police substation (right across the street), restaurants, and shopping. The room was very nice with a large open kitchen and sitting area (w/ flatscreen TV) and a separate bedroom (again w/ flatscreen TV) and a large bathroom. The room was clean and attractive. My only complaint was the lack of a table to eat at; two stools were located next to a raised counter between the kitchen and sitting area. And some traffic noise (but you are in the city :) ) The staff was pleasant and the complimentary breakfast was fine (several hot items along with cereal, fruit, and breads, served in a breakfast room that overlooks the Little Italy neighborhood on the second floor). My wife reported to me there was an outstanding health club connected to the hotel for use by guests (several small pools and exercise rooms), although we didn't use it. Baltimore has spruced up since I was there several years ago. The area around Camden Yards is very well done and the shopping and museum and dining attractions have increased, particularly around the waterfront. It appears that the city is trying to draw more residential and tourist actitivty downtown and I believe it is working.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations and Location”
Reviews.Author: Recruiting
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The rooms are huge - excellent for families, or if on business/getaway a great amount of living area. Everything is in walking distance including restaurants, grocery, water taxi, inner harbor, etc. Flat screen tvs in both the living room and the bedroom. Great service and check-in. I would definitely recommend this to others and plan on staying here again. This stay validated my commitment to the Hilton chain. They have really spruced up the inner harbor since I was here last - I would consider coming up just to do a fun weekend with family or significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Be Forewarned”
Reviews.Author: Manuela3
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to forewarn people about what happened to me, since I thought I had a secure reservation at this hotel. A woman called me this week from the hotel and very nicely told me that even though I made my reservation about 4 months ago and even though I have a reservation number and am a member of the Hilton HHonors program, my reservation cannot be "hhonored", because they overbooked and I, in fact, do NOT have a reservation it seems, at the hotel that I made a reservation at so long ago. She tried to make it sound like I was LUCKY because she is telling me NOW instead of when I actually got there (in 5 days!) and they will be happy to put me up at the AIRPORT for $169 dollars. I was quite taken aback and told her that I did not want to stay at an airport, I am not flying anywhere. I have tickets to a baseball game, and picked this hotel because I could WALK to the game. I researched this hotel and picked Homewood Suites because it sounded like it was perfect for our needs. I do NOT feel lucky to now have the opportunity to pay $169 for a hotel I do not want to be in, that is miles from where I want to be and I am very upset, that I now have no place to stay in Baltimore, because I was given less than a weeks notice. At the time I booked the hotel, I had options to stay at other places (oh man, why didn't I stick with Marriott?) some cheaper too, but I decided to try Hilton, because of it's reputation and from what I read on Tripadvisor and now there are no other hotels in downtown Baltimore with available rooms. And I am not in this situation because I waited too long or didn't get my act together. I am in it all because of Hilton. I really can't believe that we have been booted out when I made my reservation so far ahead of time and are then being asked to pay so much money for a room we don't want. Why can't I pay my $300 and get what I want? I followed the rules. They should too. I am not feeling "hhonored" by Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for big families”
Reviews.Author: JeffPink
Reviews.Content: We have a big family of 7 and found this hotel to have a suite larger enough to accomodate everyone. Our son asked if this was an apartment it was so large. The 1 bedroom suite with 2 double beds, separate family room with pullout sofa and roll-away bed was augmented by a full kitchen. The maid runs the dishwasher everyday and the free popcorn was a hit with the kids. The hotel is very close to the water taxi station and a reasonable distance to the inner harbor. We reserved the water taxi for the days we visited the more distant destinations such as Fort McHenry and the Science Center. The other 3 days we hoofed it. If you stay Monday thru Thursday they offer a complimentary dinner. We had no intentions of making use of this until the last day when everyone was so tired we did not want to venture out for dinner. We all found the complimentary dinner to be quite nice. Bottled beer and a caraf of wines complimented the meal. It is self serve, but the staff does a nice job keeping the area clean and well stocked. We used travelocity and booked the room a month in advance for what seemed to be a high rate (but less than the hotel site). One of our children was sick the night before so we changed the dates of our stay back by 1 day and the rates dropped by about $130 over the 3 nights. Go figure. I guess if they are not booked up they will drop rates rather than go empty. A strategy you might want to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: NJtravel099
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel once, and was very satisfied. It’s brand new. The location is perfect for visitors to the inner harbor. There are many great restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. There is an attached self parking garage, and you can get in and out privileges. There is a Maryland Athletic Club in the building, and you can use this full service gym for free. The free breakfast was a little bland, but you can buy breakfast in the adjacent Hilton Garden Inn. There’s a Whole Foods next door. This is a great place to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, great location, reasonable”
Reviews.Author: FrannyK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one Saturday night. $134 AAA rate. Room was a nice size, extremely comfy king bed w/LOTS of pillows, small living area w/loveseat, chair and table, nice kitchen area w/full-size frig, microwave, two burners, and a nice island counter w/two chairs. Fake hardwood in kitchen and carpet in rest of unit. Bathroom sink/counter is outside of bathroom which is nice. Everything was spotless, brand new. Enough towels, toiletries, and kitchenware for 4 people. Continental breakfast in nice large area on 2nd floor was egg soufle, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, bagels, toast, muffins, yogurt, assorted cereals and fruit, coffee, fruit drinks. Did not use spa/pools or bar. Best thing about this hotel was the staff--so friendly and warm and helpful, always smiling--they are a pleasure to deal with. The front desk staff, maintenance workers and breakfast were especially impressive. No valet parking, lot across the street, you can walk everywhere in the innerharbor area, many great restaurants nearby. No bellman, you take your luggage to your room yourself using a cart from the front desk. The front desk gives you written directions to the parking garage and even back to 95 which is a nice touch. This hotel is a great value and would be perfect for a family w/children considering the size and ammenities of the rooms. We definitely plan on a longer visit w/friends next time!

Reviews.Title: “The best of baltimore”
Reviews.Author: CUNEOGIRLS
Reviews.Content: AWESOME hotel, state of the art rooms, clean, and comfortable!!! Situated in the heart of the harbor (we are from baltimore originally) and in the hot new area with shopping and a movie theater adjacent to the hotel. Free breakfast, amazing privileges to the gym next door which rocks. We couldnt get over how great this place was and for so little $$. We will stay here again and again. Dont waste your money on the older hotels across from the harbor, this is just as close and brand new!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little studio”
Reviews.Author: MayTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at the Homewood on business travel for a conference at the Pier 5 hotel next door. Last year I stayed at the Marriott across the street, which has nicer views, but I think I will return to the Homewood in the future. It was a pleasure to unwind in the evening on a sofa and not a bed. I used the microwave to warm up my take-out restaurant food, and later for a snack. Microwave popcorn envelopes were a nice touch with the free coffee/tea service. I noticed the kitchen was fully stocked with equipment, including potholders, cooking utensils, and full range of pots/pans. The room was spic-and-span, the suite set-up was charming and I never bumped into the walls or furniture. I had a partial view of the Harbour from the 9th floor. King bed was attractive and firm. Other travelers have noted the beautiful swiveled Phillips plasma TV - some HD viewing possible; child content control, some on-demand features for a price (about the cost of a retail theater experience), hotel services/account. Hilton offers express check-out: either use the TV or call the front desk. I did the former. A comprehensive breakfast was complimentary in my room rate--overall a good experience, but some minor catering issues (butter not replaced when it ran out, egg casserole not fully cooked). I loved the Neutrogena toiletries, but there was no shower cap and no shelf or waste basket in the toilet area for feminine hygiene needs. (I pointed this out to staff). Also, despite being a Hilton member w/ a profile, my request for hypo-allergenic bedding was not prepared for arrival and I had to chase down a staff member to take care of this, discovering there is no "housekeeping" number on the phone (also, the room # was wrong on the phone). These problems were reported. Staff was very friendly during these experiences, and at the breakfast room. I liked the variety of restaurants, attractions, and support stores noted by other travelers (Whole Foods, drug store CVS under construction in particular) immediately adjacent to the hotel. But I walked about 2 blocks into Little Italy about 6 PM on a lovely spring evening (well-lit) and immediately regretted it as a solo female. Additionally, there are way too many aggressive panhandlers in the Inner Harbor. While I am used to these in my home city, travelers should prepare for the onslaught and/or the resultant guilt trips. While there were plenty of Harbour Police on patrol (some on Segways or bikes), they were not present off of the Harbour area e.g. in Little Italy. Warning: There has been major construction at the Harbour immediately in front of the Marriott and Homewood for at least one year, which curtails freedom of movement and provides early-morning sound effects.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, nice, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: JKCPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: I took my sister to Baltimore so that she could check out Univ. Baltimore grad school, and we stayed overnight at Homewood Suites. The parking garage is directly under the hotel--very convenient--and the garage elevator runs directly up to the lobby. The staff was very nice and quick during check-in and check-out. I felt the room was a little overpriced, but it cost less than other comparable hotels in the city. The room was a Studio Suite, so everything was in the same large room essentially--it was very spacious, open, and comfortable. Everything was VERY clean and seemed either relatively new or very well-kept. The bed was very comfortable as well. Overall, I was impressed with how clean and nice the room was, as I am very picky about the cleanliness of hotel rooms. My sister said the water pressure was good in the shower, and the hotel had provided nice Neutrogena soaps to use. The complimentary breakfast was good--there was a nice selection. Also, the hotel was very convenient to the downtown/inner harbor areas. We took a taxi to the inner harbor, but, had the weather been nicer, you could probably walk there in ~15 minutes. The hotel was also very convenient to Univ. of Baltimore as well as the exits to major highways. Overall, I was impressed with the hotel and its location. I would stay there again and tell friends to stay there if they were going to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MeggTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3nts whilst attending a hospital appt. Great location, walking distance to restaurants, inner harbour and other sights around. Rooms were spotless, loved the kitchen facilities, flat screen TV. The breakfast was very good compared to most places that offer free b/fast. Infact they have a small restaurant that was selling the same items for non-hotel guests. As pointed out by other's, there is a Whole foods behind the hotel, Starbucks just outside, and much more. Staff very helpful, especially "Christine" in the b/fast room..really sweet person. Will defintely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Pool a disappointment, breakfast could be better. Loved the TVs”
Reviews.Author: Ctraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites from Wednesday to Saturday in April with our two children ages 13 and 5. We chose it because it is a brand-new hotel and the picture of the indoor pool looked amazing. We were disappointed to find out that the pool pictured on the Homewood Suites website wasn't really part of the hotel. It was one of three pools belonging to a very large health club located in the same building. Children are not allowed in the large lane pool, but only in the small pool which was off to the side (and not pictured in the photos). Hotel guests are allowed access and use of the whole health club. When we asked to see the pool the front desk of the hotel gave us a pass which said it was for one free use of the fitness club or pool. It said that subsequent uses cost $20.00. Also, the fitness club is quite a hike from the elevator banks of the Homewood Suites. (It is closer to the Hilton Garden Inn which shares a building with the Homewood Suites). I saw families doing it, but I wasn't really in the mood to go through the entire building with kids and their pool gear. There, of course, are changing rooms at the health club with lockers which I assume hotel guests may use. Once you get to the fitness center, you also need to show a photo Id and have all family members sign in. All of this ended up being too many obstacles for one tired mom and in the end we never did use the pool. The room was very nice. We had a one-bedroom King suite which had a pull-out bed for the kids to share. It had two flat-screen TVs which the kids loved with pay per view movies available. The room was not overly spacious, but adequate. It would be very tight for larger families. The brand-new full kitchen was very nice. Vacationers beware! The complimentary breakfast is from 6am to 9am on weekday mornings! It was OK. They had 4 or 5 hot items every morning, but expect grits and biscuits and gravy, rather than pancakes and waffles. The biggest problem with the breakfast was that it seemed to be poorly run. They kept running out of the hot food. No matter what day or time I went up to the buffet with my kids, we were always scraping the bottom of the pan to get the last eggs, the last potatoes, etc. For two days in a row they had the same four onion bagels sitting there. They finally put new bagels out on Saturday. They ran out of "to go" coffee cups one day. The next day they ran out of silverware and everyone who got their after 8:20am had to use plastic forks. There was hotel staff overseeing the breakfast, but when they ran out of food or utensils they would just shrug. On the other hand, my 5-yr- old loved the Fruit Loops! We couldn't find any other restaurant options for breakfast within short distance to the hotel.
