The Inner Harbour is close, but not quite close enough to drag 13 year olds out of bed and make them march to it before breakfast. Families might consider buying breakfast items from Whole Foods around the corner and eating in their room if they can't make it to breakfast before 9am. Starbucks and Haagen Dazs are right next door to the hotel. The hotel is on the edge of Little Italy. We ate very well for dinner! We did walk back and forth to the Inner Harbour. The shortest route is to walk across the street to the Marriott Waterfront and then use the pier/bridges to get across. We would stay here again, because it wasn't a bad price for the accomodations and location to the Inner Harbour. Just don't expect much from breakfast and be prepared to use the health-club pool with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinQueen73
Reviews.Content: Me and my family just returned from a weekend stay at the Homewood Suites in Baltimore and we were very satisfied! We were there for "A Day Out With Thomas" and we were able to check in early at about 1pm, which was great! We stayed in a spotless one bedroom suite on the 11th floor with a city view. It was new and spacious and had everything we neeeded. We are a family of five and we had plenty of room, with 2 beds in a separate bedroom, a sofa bed, full kitchen, and 2 flat screen TVs. (The linens for the sofabed are kept in the closet in the bedroom.) The hotel is within walking distance to the Aquarium and many restaurants and attractions. The Aquarium is expensive at approximately $25.00 per adult and $20.00 per child, but the kids loved it! (The 4D show at the aquarium was fun but my little ones were scared.) You will do a bit of walking so make sure you wear comfortable walking shoes, while everything is within walking distance, somethings are a bit of a hike especially if you have young children! There is a whole foods (organic supermarket) and a wine shop across the street, a movie theatre next door to the hotel, and also a Starbucks and a Hagen Dazz store. The parking garage is attached to the hotel, and while it is $25.00 per night parking, it is very convenient and you can come and go as you please with the card given to you at the front desk. The complimentary breakfast was the best I have ever had at a hotel! There was a selection of hot and cold foods such as, bacon, sausage, eggs, potatoes, cheese grits, cereal, danish, muffins, bagels, toast. There was also juices, coffee, tea, chocolate milk and yogurts. We were worried that we wouldn't find much left because we didn't make it out of our room unitl after 9am (breakfast is over at 10am) but there was plenty and the servers (hosts) were very nice. We really were impressed with this hotel, the rooms were great and clean, the location was perfect and the price is less than most other hotels in the area. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Fun”
Reviews.Author: smellenq
Reviews.Content: What a nice place! Clean and new, with complimentary breakfast and dinners- Wow! We enjoyed the breakfasts daily but only went at dinner time for a complimentary beer before we headed out to one of the numerous dining choices within walking distance of the hotel. Inner Harbour with Science Center and Aquarium, was right there. Little Italy is adjacent to hotel. Whole Foods grocery store is around the corner so you can grab something healthy and stock it in your hotel room's fridge. We actually took advantage of Whole Foods great selection of salad and gourmet deli to bring back to the room for dinner one night. The pool at the MAC fitness center was nice, but kids were only allowed in the small side pool, which was dissapointing because they really wanted to swim laps in the big pool but were not allowed to. They also had a ridiculous rule that you had to take a shower before entering the pool so we would have to walk from the locker room to the pool dripping wet and freezing! Luckily the small pool was heated. Overall our stay was excellent. Housekeeping did a nice job. Beds were very comfortable. Decor was very modern and attractive. Location couldn't have been better. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Baltimore Inner Harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, nice, great Inner Harbor location - amazing gym!!”
Reviews.Author: Niia
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading positive Trip Advisor reviews and it's all true. Great location if you want to be in the Inner Harbor. The lobby is kind of boring and bland, but our suite was really nice. Brand new, nicely furnished, great flat screen TVs, full kitchen. The free breakfast is quite good and offers more than the usual waffles and cold cereal. They had all kinds of hot dishes and lots to choose from. Aside from a really nice room, the hotel has a deal with a gym that's in the building and this is the biggest, newest, most amazing gym I've ever seen! It's huge and brand new with the latest in every type of exercise equipment. The gym isn't part of the hotel, but you can use it free - just remember to bring a photo ID when you go. We didn't and the hotel front desk didn't tell us, so we had to go all the way back to our room. You need a pass and the front desk will give you one. This gym also has a beautiful pool area that's the nicest gym pool I've ever seen. If you enjoy exercise, be sure to check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, great location, missing staff!”
Reviews.Author: bean3
Reviews.Content: This place is brand spanking new! The room was clean and the kitchen was spotless and very well equipped! We had a room with a living area with a sleeper sofa, kitchen with 2 counter stools for eating and a seperate bedroom with 2 double beds. Plenty of room for our family of 2 adults, 2 teens and a pre-teen. The location is perfect, we were able to walk most places. Right behind the hotel is a Whole Foods Store which was perfect for our family for snacks, drinks, and breakfast items. Parking is steep at $25.00 per day, but you do have in and out privledges and there is an elevator directly from the garage to the lobby. Now, for the bad..........the staff was literally non-existent for the 5 nights we stayed. There were three towels for our family of five, we called the front desk and the phone just rang and rang and rang. After trying for 1/2 hour my husband went downstairs to request the towels. The same thing happened later that evening when we realized there was no bedding for the sleeper sofa. Again, on day two when the maid failed to leave us enough towels and NO toilet paper, the phone was never answered. We never had enough personal items the entire stay. Luckily, I had brought our own shampoo's etc... The toilet clogged on day three, again, no answer. The front desk just never answered the darn phone! Very, very poor customer service. I would think on day one, when you know that 5 people are in the room, you would make sure we had 5 towels for the each day the remainder of our stay. At the very least, I would answer the phone calls from guest! The staff never greeted us, looked at us, bothered with us once after check-in. I think this is still a good choice for families, in spite of the ghost staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Question Them”
Reviews.Author: evotwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the breakfast was great. We went with the hotel because we have always had good luck with Homewood Suites. We first stayed at the hotel in mid Jan. because of a medical appointment, which at the time of booking we asked if they give medical discount, which we were told they did & they knocked off $20.00 and we were very thankful for that. Then we booked for the surgery for end of February, this booking did not go as smooth. We were told no discount for medical, when we questioned why we got it the first time she had no response to that, she also was very rude. After much discussion, she did give us a discounted rate. We checked our reservations the next morning & they had booked a non-smoking room instead of smoking as we requested. We called the hotel & they changed the reservation, but to our surprise when we went on line to check our reservations again, they added $30.00 more onto the one nights charge. We called & ask why, they said because we made a change to our reservation. Our ? was why wasn't the second night hiked, she had nothing to say & again she was very rude & short. So as long as you don't ask for anything different you will be ok. Also when they cleaned our room and stocked the coffee, they left decaf and no regular. I am sure its because we were located on the 12th floor, which is the top, and by the time they got up there they were out of regular. I feel these hotels should be considerate to families that are coming to their city for surgeries. This was a very upsetting time in our family and to have to deal with people like this just made the situation worse. Unfortunatley we must travel back to Baltimore for yet one more surgery in a couple of weeks, we will look elsewhere for a place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 625 South President Street, Baltimore, MD 21202
